controls.name: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance Program
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of cybersecurity and data protection governance controls.

controls.name: Steering Committee & Program Oversight
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to coordinate cybersecurity, data protection and business alignment through a steering committee or advisory board, comprised of key cybersecurity, data protection and business executives, which meets formally and on a regular basis.

controls.name: Status Reporting To Governing Body
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide governance oversight reporting and recommendations to those entrusted to make executive decisions about matters considered material to the organization's cybersecurity and data protection program.

controls.name: Commitment To Continual Improvements
Publishing Cybersecurity & Data Protection Documentation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to establish, maintain and disseminate cybersecurity and data protection policies, standards and procedures.

controls.name: Exception Management
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prohibit exceptions to standards, except when the exception has been formally assessed for risk impact, approved and recorded.

controls.name: Periodic Review & Update of Cybersecurity & Data Protection Program
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to review the cybersecurity and data protection program, including policies, standards and procedures, at planned intervals or if significant changes occur to ensure their continuing suitability, adequacy and effectiveness.

controls.name: Assigned Cybersecurity & Data Protection Responsibilities
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to assign one or more qualified individuals with the mission and resources to centrally-manage, coordinate, develop, implement and maintain an enterprise-wide cybersecurity and data protection program.

controls.name: Stakeholder Accountability Structure
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce an accountability structure so that appropriate teams and individuals are empowered, responsible and trained for mapping, measuring and managing data and technology-related risks.

controls.name: Authoritative Chain of Command
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to establish an authoritative chain of command with clear lines of communication to remove ambiguity from individuals and teams related to managing data and technology-related risks.

controls.name: Measures of Performance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to develop, report and monitor cybersecurity and data protection program measures of performance.

controls.name: Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to develop, report and monitor Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to assist organizational management in performance monitoring and trend analysis of the cybersecurity and data protection program.

controls.name: Key Risk Indicators (KRIs)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to develop, report and monitor Key Risk Indicators (KRIs) to assist senior management in performance monitoring and trend analysis of the cybersecurity and data protection program.

controls.name: Contacts With Authorities
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and document appropriate contacts with relevant law enforcement and regulatory bodies.

controls.name: Contacts With Groups & Associations
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to establish contact with selected groups and associations within the cybersecurity and data privacy communities to: 
(1) Facilitate ongoing cybersecurity and data protection education and training for organizational personnel;
(2) Maintain currency with recommended cybersecurity and data protection practices, techniques and technologies; and
(3) Share current cybersecurity and/or data privacy-related information including threats, vulnerabilities and incidents.

controls.name: Defining Business Context & Mission
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define the context of its business model and document the organization's mission.

controls.name: Define Control Objectives
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to establish control objectives as the basis for the selection, implementation and management of the organization's internal control system.

controls.name: Data Governance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate data governance to oversee the organization's policies, standards and procedures so that sensitive/regulated data is effectively managed and maintained in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.

controls.name: Purpose Validation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to monitor mission/business-critical Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) to ensure those resources are being used consistent with their intended purpose.

controls.name: Forced Technology Transfer (FTT)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to avoid and/or constrain the forced exfiltration of sensitive/regulated information (e.g., Intellectual Property (IP)) to the host government for purposes of market access or market management practices.

controls.name: State-Sponsored Espionage
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to constrain the host government's ability to leverage the organization's Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) for economic or political espionage and/or cyberwarfare activities.

controls.name: Business As Usual (BAU) Secure Practices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to incorporate cybersecurity and data protection principles into Business As Usual (BAU) practices through executive leadership involvement.

controls.name: Operationalizing Cybersecurity & Data Protection Practices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to compel data and/or process owners to operationalize cybersecurity and data protection practices for each Technology Asset, Application and/or Service (TAAS) under their control.

controls.name: Select Controls
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to compel data and/or process owners to select required cybersecurity and data protection controls for each Technology Asset, Application and/or Service (TAAS) under their control.

controls.name: Implement Controls
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to compel data and/or process owners to implement required cybersecurity and data protection controls for each Technology Asset, Application and/or Service (TAAS) under their control.

controls.name: Assess Controls
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to compel data and/or process owners to assess if required cybersecurity and data protection controls for each Technology Asset, Application and/or Service (TAAS) under their control are implemented correctly and are operating as intended.

controls.name: Authorize Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to compel data and/or process owners to obtain authorization for the production use of each Technology Asset, Application and/or Service (TAAS) under their control.

controls.name: Monitor Controls
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to compel data and/or process owners to monitor Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) under their control on an ongoing basis for applicable threats and risks, as well as to ensure cybersecurity and data protection controls are operating as intended.

controls.name: Materiality Determination
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define materiality threshold criteria capable of designating an incident as material.

controls.name: Material Risks
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define criteria necessary to designate a risk as a material risk.

controls.name: Material Threats
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define criteria necessary to designate a threat as a material threat.

controls.name: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Status Reporting
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to submit status reporting of the organization's cybersecurity and/or data privacy program to applicable statutory and/or regulatory authorities, as required.

controls.name: Quality Management System (QMS)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to govern a Quality Management System (QMS) to ensure cybersecurity and data protection processes conform with applicable statutory, regulatory and/or contractual obligations.

controls.name: Assurance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define the basis for confidence that implemented practices conform to applicable security, compliance and resilience controls, where the control implementation performs as intended.

controls.name: Assurance Levels (AL)
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to utilize defined Assurance Levels (AL) for assessment activities to standardize the following assurance attributes:
(1) Depth that addresses the rigor and level of detail of the assessment; and
(2) Coverage that addresses the scope and breadth of the assessment.

controls.name: Assessment Objectives (AO)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize defined Assessment Objectives (AO) to assess the implementation of requirements, when available.

controls.name: Mergers, Acquisitions & Divestitures (MA&D)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define standardized practices to conduct Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestiture (MA&D) activities.

controls.name: Virtual Data Room (VDR)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provision a Virtual Data Room (VDR), or similar technology, to securely share documentation among stakeholders to conduct Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestiture (MA&D) activities.

controls.name: Artificial Intelligence (AI) & Autonomous Technologies Governance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure policies, processes, procedures and practices related to the mapping, measuring and managing of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT)-related risks are in place, transparent and implemented effectively.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies-Related Legal Requirements Definition
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify, understand, document and manage applicable statutory and regulatory requirements for Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: Trustworthy AI & Autonomous Technologies
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) are designed to be reliable, safe, fair, secure, resilient, transparent, explainable and data privacy-enhanced to minimize emergent properties or unintended consequences.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Value Sustainment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to sustain the value of deployed Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: AI Model & Agent Inventory & Lifecycle Management
Situational Awareness of AI & Autonomous Technologies
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to develop and maintain an inventory of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) (internal and third-party).

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Risk Mapping
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) in use and map those components to potential legal risks, including statutory and regulatory compliance requirements.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Internal Controls
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and document internal cybersecurity and data protection controls for Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: Adequate Protections For AI & Autonomous Technologies
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) include reasonable cybersecurity and data protections that are commensurate with assessed risks and threats.

controls.name: AI Threat Modeling & Risk Assessment
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to conduct Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT)-specific threat modeling and risk assessments to address the following criteria across the lifecycle of the AAT:
(1) Attack surfaces;
(2) Adversarial threats; and 
(3) Abuse / misuse scenarios.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Context Definition
AI & Autonomous Technologies Mission and Goals Definition
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define and document the organization's mission and defined goals for Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: Model & AI Agent Documentation
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to create, maintain and provide access to documentation artifacts for AI models and agents, including:
(1) Data lineage;
(2) Intended use; and 
(3) Limitations.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Business Case
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to benchmark capabilities, targeted usage, goals and expected benefits and costs of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Potential Benefits Analysis
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to assess the potential benefits of proposed Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Potential Costs Analysis
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to assess potential costs, including non-monetary costs, resulting from expected or realized Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT)-related errors or system functionality and trustworthiness.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Targeted Application Scope
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to specify and document the targeted application scope of the proposed use and operation of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Cost / Benefit Mapping
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to map risks and benefits for all components of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT), including third-party software and data.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Training
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure personnel and external stakeholders are provided with position-specific risk management training for Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Fairness & Bias
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) from unfairly identifying, profiling and/or statistically singling out a segmented population defined by race, religion, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or any other politically-charged identifier.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Risk Management Decisions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to leverage decision makers from a diversity of demographics, disciplines, experience, expertise and backgrounds for mapping, measuring and managing Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT)-related risks.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Impact Assessment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to assess the impact(s) of proposed Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) on individuals, groups, communities, organizations and society (e.g., Fundamental Rights Impact Assessment (FRIA)).

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Likelihood & Impact Risk Analysis
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define the potential likelihood and impact of each identified risk based on expected use and past uses of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) in similar contexts.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Continuous Improvements
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to continuously improve Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) capabilities to maximize benefits and minimize negative impacts associated with AAT.

controls.name: Assigned Responsibilities for AI & Autonomous Technologies
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to define and differentiate roles and responsibilities for:
(1) Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) configurations; and
(2) Oversight of AAT systems.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Risk Profiling
AI & Autonomous Technologies High Risk Designations
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to designate Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) "High Risk" if one(1), or more, of the following criteria are met:
(1) AAT is used as a safety component of a product or service;
(2) AAT poses a significant risk of harm to an individual's health, safety or fundamental rights; and/or
(3) AAT materially influences the outcome of an individual's decision making.

controls.name: Artificial Intelligence Test, Evaluation, Validation & Verification (AI TEVV)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement Artificial Intelligence Test, Evaluation, Validation & Verification (AI TEVV) practices to enable Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT)-related security, resilience and compliance-related conformity testing throughout the lifecycle of the AAT.

controls.name: AI TEVV Trustworthiness Assessment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to evaluate Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) for trustworthy behavior and operation including security, anonymization and disaggregation of captured and stored data for approved purposes.

controls.name: AI TEVV Tools
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to document test sets, metrics and details about the tools used during Artificial Intelligence Test, Evaluation, Validation & Verification (AI TEVV) practices.

controls.name: AI TEVV Trustworthiness Demonstration
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to demonstrate the Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) to be deployed are:
(1) Valid;
(2) Reliable; and
(3) Operate as intended, based on approved designs.

controls.name: AI TEVV Safety Demonstration
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to demonstrate the Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) to be deployed are safe, residual risk does not exceed the organization's risk tolerance and can fail safely, particularly if made to operate beyond its knowledge limits.

controls.name: AI TEVV Security & Resiliency Assessment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to evaluate the security and resilience of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) to be deployed.

controls.name: AI TEVV Transparency & Accountability Assessment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to examine risks associated with transparency and accountability of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) to be deployed.

controls.name: AI TEVV Privacy Assessment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to examine the data privacy risk of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) to be deployed.

controls.name: AI TEVV Fairness & Bias Assessment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to examine fairness and bias of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) to be deployed.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Model Validation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to validate the Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) model.

controls.name: AI TEVV Results Evaluation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to evaluate the results of Artificial Intelligence Test, Evaluation, Validation & Verification (AI TEVV) to determine the viability of the proposed Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: AI TEVV Effectiveness
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to evaluate the effectiveness of the processes utilized to perform Artificial Intelligence Test, Evaluation, Validation & Verification (AI TEVV).

controls.name: AI TEVV Comparable Deployment Settings
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to evaluate Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT)-related performance or the assurance criteria demonstrated for conditions similar to deployment settings.

controls.name: AI TEVV Post-Deployment Monitoring
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to proactively and continuously monitor deployed Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: Updating AI & Autonomous Technologies
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to integrate continual improvements for deployed Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: AI TEVV Reporting
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to report the status and results of Artificial Intelligence Test, Evaluation, Validation & Verification (AI TEVV) to relevant stakeholders, including governing bodies, as required.

controls.name: AI TEVV Empirically Validated Methods
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to evaluate claims of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) model capabilities using empirically validated methods.

controls.name: AI TEVV Benchmarking Content Provenance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to benchmark the verifiable lineage and origin of content used by Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) according to industry-recognized standards.

controls.name: AI TEVV Model Collapse Mitigations
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to mitigate concerns of model collapse by:
(1) Assessing the proportion of synthetic to non-synthetic training data; and
(2) Verifying training data is not overly homogenous or Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) system-produced.

controls.name: AI TEVV Third-Party Risk Management
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to assess, approve and continuously monitor third-party Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT):
(1) Components;
(2) Application Programming Interfaces (APIs); and/or
(3) Services used by AI agents for security, privacy and compliance.

controls.name: Robust Stakeholder Engagement for AI & Autonomous Technologies
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to compel ongoing engagement with relevant Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) stakeholders to encourage feedback about positive, negative and unanticipated impacts.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Stakeholder Feedback Integration
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to regularly collect, consider, prioritize and integrate risk-related feedback from those external to the team that developed or deployed Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Ongoing Assessments
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to conduct regular assessments of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) with independent assessors and stakeholders not involved in the development of the AAT.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies End User Feedback
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to collect and integrate feedback from end users and impacted communities into Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT)-related system evaluation metrics.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Incident & Error Reporting
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to communicate Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT)-related incidents and/or errors to relevant stakeholders, including affected communities.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Intellectual Property Infringement Protections
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent third-party Intellectual Property (IP) rights infringement by Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: Data Source Identification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and document data sources utilized in the training and/or operation of Artificial Intelligence and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: Data Source Integrity
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect the integrity of source data to prevent accidental contamination or malicious corruption (e.g., data poisoning) that could compromise the performance of Artificial Intelligence and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: Data Source Lineage & Origin Disclosure
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to ensure Artificial Intelligence and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) publicly disclose information with sufficient detail to assess:
(1) Content lineage; and 
(2) The origin of data used by the AAT.

controls.name: Digital Content Modification Logging
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to ensure Artificial Intelligence and Autonomous Technologies (AAT):
(1) Enable auditing of content modifications; and 
(2) Generate event logs for content-related changes.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Stakeholder Diversity
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) stakeholder competencies, skills and capacities incorporate demographic diversity, broad domain and user experience expertise.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Stakeholder Competencies
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT)-related operator and practitioner proficiency requirements for Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) are defined, assessed and documented.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Requirements Definitions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to take socio-technical implications into account to address risks associated with Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Implementation Tasks Definition
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define the tasks that Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) will support (e.g., classifiers, generative models, recommenders).

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Knowledge Limits
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and document knowledge limits of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) to provide sufficient information to assist relevant stakeholder decision making.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Viability Decisions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define the criteria as to whether Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) achieved intended purposes and stated objectives to determine whether its development or deployment should proceed.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Negative Residual Risks
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and document negative, residual risks (defined as the sum of all unmitigated risks) to both downstream acquirers and end users of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: Responsibility To Supersede, Deactivate and/or Disengage AI & Autonomous Technologies
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define the criteria and responsible party(ies) for superseding, disengaging or deactivating Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) that demonstrate performance or outcomes inconsistent with intended use.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Production Monitoring
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to monitor the functionality and behavior of the deployed Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Measurement Approaches
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to measure Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT)-related risks to deployment context(s) through review and consultation with industry experts, domain specialists and end users.

controls.name: Measuring AI & Autonomous Technologies Effectiveness
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to regularly assess the effectiveness of existing controls, including reports of errors and potential impacts on affected communities.

controls.name: Unmeasurable AI & Autonomous Technologies Risks
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and document unmeasurable risks or trustworthiness characteristics.

controls.name: Efficacy of AI & Autonomous Technologies Measurement
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to gather and assess feedback about the efficacy of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT)-related measurements.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Domain Expert Reviews
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize input from domain experts and relevant stakeholders to validate whether the Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) perform consistently, as intended.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Performance Changes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to evaluate performance improvements or declines with domain experts and relevant stakeholders to define context-relevant risks and trustworthiness issues.

controls.name: Pre-Trained AI & Autonomous Technologies Models
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to validate the information source(s) and quality of pre-trained models used in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) training, maintenance and improvement-related activities.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Event Logging
Serious Incident Reporting For AI & Autonomous Technologies
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to report any serious incident involving operational Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) to relevant authorities as to when and where the serious incident occurred, in accordance with mandated reporting timelines.

controls.name: Serious Incident Root Cause Analysis (RCA) For AI & Autonomous Technologies
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to perform an investigation when there is a serious incident involving operational Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) that documents a:
(1) Root Cause Analysis (RCA);
(2) Risk assessment of the incident; and 
(3) Description of corrective actions taken, including measures implemented to prevent a recurrence of the incident.

controls.name: Anomaly Detection & Human Oversight
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to analyze anomalous Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) behavior and provide escalation paths for human oversight, including:
(1) Real-time review; and
(2) Intervention.

controls.name: Human-in-the-Loop & Escalation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to require human review and clear escalation paths for approval for high-risk or ambiguous Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) actions.

controls.name: Emergent Behavior & Collusion Protections
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to detect and contain emergent or collusive behaviors among multiple Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT), including:
(1) Automated or human-triggered containment; and 
(2) Formal investigation to determine the root cause of agentic cascades or collusion.

controls.name: Multi-Agent Trust & Communication Validation
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to validate AI agent to AI agent communications to:
(1) Detect poisoning or consensus manipulation; and 
(2) Identify rogue or compromised AI agents in distributed or multi-agent environments.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Harm Prevention
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to proactively prevent harm by regularly identifying and tracking existing, unanticipated and emergent Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT)-related risks.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Human Subject Protections
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect human subjects from harm.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Environmental Impact & Sustainability
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to assess and document the environmental impacts and sustainability of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: Previously Unknown AI & Autonomous Technologies Threats & Risks
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to respond to and recover from a previously unknown Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT)-related risk when it is identified.

controls.name: Novel Risk Assessment Methods & Technologies
Fine Tuning Risk Mitigation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure actions to fine-tune Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) do not compromise existing safety and/or security controls.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Risk Tracking Approaches
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to track Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT)-related risks are difficult to assess using currently available measurement techniques or where metrics are not yet available.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Risk Response
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prioritize, respond to and remediate Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT)-related risks based on assessments and other analytical output.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Conformity
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to ensure deployed Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) conform to applicable statutory and regulatory requirements, based on:
(1) Defined use cases;
(2) Geographic markets; and
(3) Use of Intellectual Property (IP).

controls.name: Manipulative or Deceptive Techniques
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prohibit the sale, deployment and/or use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) that utilize manipulative or deceptive techniques (including biased data) to impair an individual's ability to make a reasonably informed decision.

controls.name: Materially Distorting Behaviors
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to prohibit the sale, deployment and/or use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) that exploit a human subject to materially affect a targeted behavior due to their:
(1) Age;
(2) Disability; or 
(3) Specific social or economic situation.

controls.name: Social Scoring
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to prohibit the sale, deployment and/or use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) that: 
(1) Evaluate human subjects over a certain period of time based on their social behavior or known, inferred or predicted personal or personality characteristics; and
(2) Assign a "social score" branding or equivalent classification.

controls.name: Detrimental or Unfavorable Treatment
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to prohibit the sale, deployment and/or use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) that lead to the detrimental or unfavorable treatment of certain data subjects, or groups of data subjects, in social contexts that is:
(1) Are unrelated to the contexts in which the data was originally generated or collected; and/or
(2) Is unjustified or disproportionate to their social behavior or its gravity.

controls.name: Risk and Criminal Profiling
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to prohibit the sale, deployment and/or use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) that:
(1) Assess the risk of an individual committing a criminal offence; and
(2) Predicts risk based solely on the profiling of personality traits and characteristics.

controls.name: Populating Facial Recognition Databases
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to prohibit the sale, deployment and/or use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) that create, or expand, facial recognition databases through scraping facial images from:
(1) The Internet; or 
(2) Closed-Circuit Television (CCTV) footage.

controls.name: Emotion Inference
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prohibit the sale, deployment and/or use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) that infer human emotions of an individual based on observed characteristics.

controls.name: Biometric Categorization
AI & Autonomous Technologies Development Practices
controls.description:
Measures exist to ensure Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) are designed and developed to:
(1) Achieve an appropriate level of accuracy, robustness and cybersecurity; 
(2) Perform consistently in those respects throughout the AAT system's lifecycle; and
(3) Be effectively overseen by competent individuals.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Transparency
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) are designed and developed so its operation is sufficiently transparent such that output can be easily interpreted by personnel implementing the AAT.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Implementation Documentation
AI & Autonomous Technologies Human Domain Knowledge Reliance
AI & Autonomous Technologies Registration
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to maintain a current registration for Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) with the appropriate governing body, as required by statutory or regulatory requirements.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Deployment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure the deployment of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) includes appropriate technical and organizational measures so that AAT are used in accordance with the AAT developer-provided instructions for use.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Human Oversight
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to assign human oversight of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) to prevent or minimize the risks to:
(1) Health; 
(2) Safety; and/or 
(3) Fundamental rights.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Oversight Measures
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to ensure Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) oversight measures are commensurate with the:
(1) Assessed risk(s); 
(2) Level of autonomy; and 
(3) Context of use.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Separate Verification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure no action or decision is taken by the deployer of an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) based solely based on AAT-generated evidence, unless that evidence has been separately verified and confirmed by at least two (2) individuals with the necessary competence, training and authority.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Oversight Functions Competency
AI & Autonomous Technologies Data Relevance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure the input to Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) is relevant to the intended purpose of the AAT.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Irregularity Reporting
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to ensure serious incidents and/or irregularities associated with the deployment of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) are reported without delay to the:
(1) AAT provider;
(2) AAT importer or distributor, if applicable; and/or
(3) Local law authorities and/or governmental agency, as required.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Use Notification To Employees
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure employees, including workers' representatives, are informed about Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) deployments, prior to the use of the AAT in a production environment.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Use Notification To Users
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to ensure Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) that make decisions, or assist in making decisions, inform the people in a clear manner that they are:
(1) Utilizing an AAT solution; and
(2) Expected to validate the output for relevance and accuracy.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Output Marking
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to mark output from Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) in a machine-readable format so it is detectable as artificially generated or manipulated.

controls.name: Real World Testing of AI & Autonomous Technologies
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to obtain consent from the subjects of testing Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT):
(1) Prior to their participation in such testing; and
(2) After they have been provided with clear and concise information regarding the testing.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies System Value Chain
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to document the sequence of events and relevant stakeholders involved in creating and deploying Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies System Value Chain Fallbacks
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to identify:
(1) Over-reliance on third-party data with Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT); and
(2) Fallback methods to address the inability to access third-party data, as necessary.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Testing Techniques
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to develop and implement fact-checking techniques to verify the accuracy and veracity of information generated by Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: Generative Artificial Intelligence (GAI) Identification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to develop and implement testing techniques to identify Generative Artificial Intelligence (GAI) produced content (e.g., synthetic media).

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Capabilities Testing
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to delineate human prociency tests from tests of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) capabilities.

controls.name: Real-World Testing
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to include relevant end-users, practitioners and operators in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) prototyping and testing activities to cover:
(1) Applicable use case scenarios;
(2) Crisis situations; and/or 
(3) Ethically sensitive contexts.

controls.name: Documenting Testing Guidance
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to document the instructions given to:
(1) Data annotators; and/or 
(2) Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) red-teamers.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Output Filtering
Human Moderation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to assign personnel to review Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT)-generated content for alignment with culturally accepted norms.

controls.name: AI Model Resilience
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure AI models are designed with resilience capabilities that are sufficient to withstand reasonable threats.

controls.name: Model Pollution
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent "model pollution" due to accidental and/or malicious inputs by an AI agent that can negatively alter the AI model.

controls.name: Cascading Hallucination Defense
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to detect and prevent the propagation of false data (e.g., hallucinations) within the AI model or between AI agents.

controls.name: Resource Exhaustion & DoS Resilience
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to monitor and prevent resource overload or Denial of Service (DoS) conditions through:
(1) Enforcement of quotas;
(2) Workload controls; and 
(3) Auto-suspension of runaway AI agent processes.

controls.name: AI Agent Governance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure AI agents are designed, developed and deployed to securely operate under human oversight.

controls.name: Infrastructure Hardening & Isolation
AI Agent Limitations
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to implement limitations for AI agents according to:
(1) Least privileges, where the AI agent operates with the minimal permissions necessary to perform designated tasks; and
(2) Least functionality, where the AI agent is restricted to communicate with the minimal Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) and networks necessary to perform designated tasks.

controls.name: Tool & API Invocation Controls
Orchestration Protocol Safeguards
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to validate, secure and restrict AI agent orchestration protocols to prevent:
(1) Unauthorized tool chaining;
(2) Context manipulation; and/or
(3) Protocol-based escalation.

controls.name: Data Pipeline & Input Integrity
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to validate, sanitize and monitor all data inputs and retrieval pipelines for AI agents to:
(1) Ensure data provenance; and 
(2) Prevent unauthorized access risks (e.g., injection, manipulation or exfiltration).

controls.name: Privileged Role & Delegation Boundaries
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to prevent privilege escalation or unauthorized delegation by AI agents by:
(1) Monitoring and enforcing dynamic roles; and
(2) Establishing cross-agent delegation boundaries and privileged actions.

controls.name: AI Agent Data Access Restrictions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict agent access to sensitive/regulated data so that AI agents cannot ingest, generate or act on unauthorized data.

controls.name: Data Extraction
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent AI agents from extracting sensitive/regulated data from volatile memory that can be exploited at a later point.

controls.name: AI Agent Identity & Impersonation Defense
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to ensure user identification and authentication methods are capable of preventing AI agents from 
(1) Spoofing;
(2) Mimicry; and/or
(3) Impersonation attacks.

controls.name: AI Agent Logic Integrity
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent AI agent logic from being subverted or manipulated.

controls.name: Sandboxing AI Agents
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize a "sandbox" capability to restrict AI agents from unrestricted access to both local and remote resources.

controls.name: Prompt Injection Defense
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to detect and mitigate prompt injection / input attacks that seek to manipulate AI agent instructions, bypass controls or result in unauthorized actions.

controls.name: Agent Kill Switch / User Control
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to allow authorized users or operators to immediately halt or disable AI agent activity in case of unexpected behavior or harm.

controls.name: Adversarial & Red Team Testing
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to regularly conduct adversarial testing that simulates attacks against AI agents to identify and mitigate vulnerabilities.

controls.name: Self-Modification Controls
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to control, restrict and log AI agent self-modification.

controls.name: Purging AI Agent Data
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict purging of any persistent memory or long-term data used by AI agents.

controls.name: Delegation and Chaining Control
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict agentic delegation, chaining and multi-agent communication to prevent unauthorized task escalation or emergent risks.

controls.name: Behavioral Drift Detection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to continuously monitor for behavioral drift or deviation from established AI agent baselines.

controls.name: AI Agent Action Authentication & Authorization
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure that all AI agent-initiated actions are properly mapped to authenticated user or system identities, with enforced authorization checks.

controls.name: Transparency & Audit
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to provide comprehensive audit trails of AI agent actions including:
(1) Rationales; and 
(2) User/trigger mappings.

controls.name: Explainability
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to:
(1) Provide human-understandable explanations for significant AI agent actions or decisions; and 
(2) Enable users to contest outcomes.

controls.name: Ethics, Fairness & Bias Detection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to detect unfair, unethical or biased AI agent actions.

controls.name: Agent Output Integrity & Verification
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to validate AI agent-generated outputs through the use of:
(1) Content scanning; and
(2) Output vetting through human approvals, where appropriate.

controls.name: Agentic Output Traceability & Repudiation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure AI agent actions offer non-repudiation and enable forensic examination to determine accountability.

controls.name: AI Agent Logging
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to generate event logs for Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) actions to ensure transparency and auditability.

controls.name: Session Management
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to control AI agent sessions by:
(1) Embedding session IDs into the requests to the AI model;
(2) Implementing capabilities to correlate sessions; and
(3) Terminating sessions after a defined time period.

controls.name: Human-in-the-Loop Workload & Manipulation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent cognitive overload or decision fatigue for humans-in-the-loop (HITL) through risk-based prioritization.

controls.name: Robotic Process Automation (RPA)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement Robotic Process Automation (RPA) to improve efficiency, accuracy and speed for high-volume, repetitive and rules-based business processes.

controls.name: Business Process Task Enumeration
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and enumerate business process task activities that can be executed both manually and in an automated fashion.

controls.name: Asset Governance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate an IT Asset Management (ITAM) program to implement and manage asset management controls.

controls.name: Asset-Service Dependencies
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and assess the security of Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS), Applications and/or Services (TAAS) that support more than one critical business function.

controls.name: Stakeholder Identification & Involvement
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and involve pertinent stakeholders of critical Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD) to support the ongoing secure management of those assets.

controls.name: Standardized Naming Convention
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement a scalable, standardized naming convention for Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD) that avoids asset naming conflicts.

controls.name: Approved Technologies
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to maintain a current list of approved technologies (hardware and software).

controls.name: Asset Inventories
Updates During Installations / Removals
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to update asset inventories as part of component installations, removals and asset upgrades.

controls.name: Automated Unauthorized Component Detection
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to detect and alert upon the detection of unauthorized hardware, software and firmware components.

controls.name: Component Duplication Avoidance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to establish and maintain an authoritative source and repository to provide a trusted source and accountability for approved and implemented system components that prevents assets from being duplicated in other asset inventories.

controls.name: Approved Baseline Deviations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to document and govern instances of approved deviations from established baseline configurations.

controls.name: Network Access Control (NAC)
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to employ Network Access Control (NAC), or a similar technology, which is capable of detecting unauthorized devices and disable network access to those unauthorized devices.

controls.name: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) Server Logging
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enable Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) server logging to improve asset inventories and assist in detecting unknown systems.

controls.name: Software Licensing Restrictions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect Intellectual Property (IP) rights with software licensing restrictions.

controls.name: Data Action Mapping
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to create and maintain a map of Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) where sensitive/regulated data is stored, transmitted or processed.

controls.name: Configuration Management Database (CMDB)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement and manage a Configuration Management Database (CMDB), or similar technology, to monitor and govern technology asset-specific information.

controls.name:
Automated Location
Tracking
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to track the geographic location of system components.

controls.name: Component Assignment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to bind components to a specific system.

controls.name: Asset Ownership Assignment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure asset ownership responsibilities are assigned, tracked and managed at a team, individual, or responsible organization level to establish a common understanding of requirements for asset protection.

controls.name: Accountability Information
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to include capturing the name, position and/or role of individuals responsible/accountable for administering assets as part of the technology asset inventory process.

controls.name: Provenance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to track the origin, development, ownership, location and changes to Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD).

controls.name: Network Diagrams & Data Flow Diagrams (DFDs)
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to maintain network architecture diagrams that: 
(1) Contain sufficient detail to assess the security of the network's architecture;
(2) Reflect the current architecture of the network environment; and
(3) Document all sensitive/regulated data flows.

controls.name: Asset Scope Classification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to determine cybersecurity and data protection control applicability by identifying, assigning and documenting the appropriate asset scope categorization for all Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) and personnel (internal and third-parties).

controls.name: Control Applicability Boundary Graphical Representation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure control applicability is appropriately-determined for Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) and third parties by graphically representing applicable boundaries.

controls.name: Compliance-Specific Asset Identification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to create and maintain a current inventory of Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD) that are in scope for statutory, regulatory and/or contractual compliance obligations that provides sufficient detail to determine control applicability, based on asset scope categorization.

controls.name: Security of Assets & Media
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to maintain strict control over the internal or external distribution of any kind of sensitive/regulated media.

controls.name: Management Approval For External Media Transfer
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to obtain management approval for any sensitive/regulated media that is transferred outside of the organization's facilities.

controls.name: Unattended End-User Equipment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement enhanced protection measures for unattended technology assets to protect against tampering and unauthorized access.

controls.name: Asset Storage In Automobiles
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to educate users on the need to physically secure laptops and other mobile devices out of sight when traveling, preferably in the trunk of a vehicle.

controls.name: Kiosks & Point of Interaction (PoI) Devices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to appropriately protect devices that capture sensitive/regulated data via direct physical interaction from tampering and substitution.

controls.name: Physical Tampering Detection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to periodically inspect systems and system components for Indicators of Compromise (IoC).

controls.name: Secure Disposal, Destruction or Re-Use of Equipment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to securely dispose of, destroy or repurpose system components using organization-defined techniques and methods to prevent information being recovered from these components.

controls.name: Return of Assets
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure that employees and third-party users return all organizational assets in their possession upon termination of employment, contract or agreement.

controls.name: Removal of Assets
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to authorize, control and track technology assets entering and exiting organizational facilities.

controls.name: Use of Personal Devices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict the possession and/or use of personally-owned Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) within organization-controlled facilities.

controls.name: Use of Third-Party Devices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to reduce the risk associated with third-party assets that are attached to the network from harming organizational assets or exfiltrating organizational data.

controls.name: Usage Parameters
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to monitor and enforce usage parameters that limit the potential damage caused from the unauthorized or unintentional alteration of system parameters.

controls.name: Bluetooth & Wireless Devices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent the usage of Bluetooth and wireless devices (e.g., Near Field Communications (NFC)) in sensitive areas or unless used in a Radio Frequency (RF)-screened building.

controls.name: Infrared Communications
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent line of sight and reflected infrared (IR) communications use in an unsecured space.

controls.name: Logical Tampering Protection
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to assess the integrity of critical Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) to detect evidence of tampering, where:
(1)	Logical assessments evaluate the integrity of critical components (e.g., configuration settings); and
(2)	Physical assessments evaluate assets for evidence of unauthorized access and/or modifications.

controls.name: Technology Asset Inspections
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to physically and logically inspect critical technology assets to detect evidence of tampering.

controls.name: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) Usage
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement and govern a Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) program to reduce risk associated with personally-owned devices in the workplace.

controls.name: Prohibited Equipment & Services
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to govern Supply Chain Risk Management (SCRM) sanctions that require the removal and prohibition of certain Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) that are designated as supply chain threats by a statutory or regulatory body.

controls.name: Roots of Trust Protection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provision and protect the confidentiality, integrity and authenticity of product supplier keys and data that can be used as a roots of trust basis for integrity verification.

controls.name: Telecommunications Equipment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to establish usage restrictions and implementation guidance for telecommunication equipment to prevent potential damage or unauthorized modification and to prevent potential eavesdropping.

controls.name: Video Teleconference (VTC) Security
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement secure Video Teleconference (VTC) capabilities on endpoint devices and in designated conference rooms, to prevent potential eavesdropping.

controls.name: Voice Over Internet Protocol (VoIP) Security
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement secure Internet Protocol Telephony (IPT) that logically or physically separates Voice Over Internet Protocol (VoIP) traffic from data networks.

controls.name: Microphones & Web Cameras
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to configure assets to prohibit the use of endpoint-based microphones and web cameras in secure areas or where sensitive/regulated information is discussed.

controls.name: Multi-Function Devices (MFD)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to securely configure Multi-Function Devices (MFD) according to industry-recognized secure practices for the type of device.

controls.name: Travel-Only Devices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to issue personnel travelling overseas with temporary, loaner or "travel-only" end user technology (e.g., laptops and mobile devices) when travelling to authoritarian countries with a higher-than average risk for Intellectual Property (IP) theft or espionage against individuals and private companies.

controls.name: Re-Imaging Devices After Travel
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to re-image end user technology (e.g., laptops and mobile devices) when returning from overseas travel to an authoritarian country with a higher-than average risk for Intellectual Property (IP) theft or espionage against individuals and private companies.

controls.name: System Administrative Processes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to develop, implement and govern system administration processes, with corresponding Standardized Operating Procedures (SOP), for operating and maintaining Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Jump Server
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to conduct remote system administrative functions via a "jump box" or "jump server" that is located in a separate network zone to user workstations.

controls.name: Database Administrative Processes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to develop, implement and govern database management processes, with corresponding Standardized Operating Procedures (SOP), for operating and maintaining databases.

controls.name: Database Management System (DBMS)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement and maintain Database Management Systems (DBMSs), where applicable.

controls.name: Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) Security
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to securely govern Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) deployments to ensure RFID is used safely and securely to protect the confidentiality and integrity of data and prevent the compromise of secure spaces.

controls.name: Contactless Access Control Systems
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to securely configure contactless access control systems incorporating contactless RFID or smart cards to protect the confidentiality and integrity of data and prevent the compromise of secure spaces.

controls.name: Decommissioning
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) are properly decommissioned so that data is properly transitioned to new systems or archived in accordance with applicable organizational standards, as well as statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.

controls.name: Asset Categorization
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to categorize Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Categorize Artificial Intelligence (AI)-Related Technologies
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to categorize Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT).

controls.name: High-Risk Asset Categorization
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to categorize a system and/or service as "High Risk" if it poses a significant risk of harm to an individual's:
(1) Health;
(2) Safety; and/or 
(3) Fundamental human rights.

controls.name: Asset Attributes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to dynamically associate asset-specific attributes to enable Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC).

controls.name: Automated Network Asset Discovery
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to automate network asset discovery through Software Defined Networking (SDN), or similar technologies, that analyzes network traffic to:
(1) Identify;
(2) Document; and 
(3) Track devices.

controls.name: Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of contingency planning controls to help ensure resilient Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) (e.g., Continuity of Operations Plan (COOP) or Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery (BC/DR) playbooks).

controls.name: Coordinate with Related Plans
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to coordinate contingency plan development with internal and external elements responsible for related plans.

controls.name: Coordinate With External Service Providers
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to coordinate internal contingency plans with the contingency plans of external service providers to ensure that contingency requirements can be satisfied.

controls.name: Transfer to Alternate Processing / Storage Site
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to redeploy personnel to other roles during a disruptive event or in the execution of a continuity plan.

controls.name: Recovery Time / Point Objectives (RTO / RPO)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate recovery operations in accordance with Recovery Time Objectives (RTOs) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPOs).

controls.name: Recovery Operations Criteria
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define specific criteria that must be met to initiate Business Continuity / Disaster Recover (BC/DR) plans that facilitate business continuity operations capable of meeting applicable Recovery Time Objectives (RTOs) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPOs).

controls.name: Recovery Operations Communications
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to communicate the status of recovery activities and progress in restoring operational capabilities to designated internal and external stakeholders.

controls.name: Identify Critical Assets
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and document the critical Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD) that support essential missions and business functions.

controls.name: Resume All Missions & Business Functions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to resume all missions and business functions within Recovery Time Objectives (RTOs) of the contingency plan's activation.

controls.name: Continue Essential Mission & Business Functions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to continue essential missions and business functions with little or no loss of operational continuity and sustain that continuity until full system restoration at primary processing and/or storage sites.

controls.name: Resume Essential Missions & Business Functions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to resume essential missions and business functions within an organization-defined time period of contingency plan activation.

controls.name: Data Storage Location Reviews
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform periodic security reviews of storage locations that contain sensitive/regulated data.

controls.name: Contingency Training
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to adequately train contingency personnel and applicable stakeholders in their contingency roles and responsibilities.

controls.name: Simulated Events
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to incorporate simulated events into contingency training to facilitate effective response by personnel in crisis situations.

controls.name: Automated Training Environments
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to provide a more thorough and realistic contingency training environment.

controls.name: Contingency Plan Testing & Exercises
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to conduct tests and/or exercises to evaluate the contingency plan's effectiveness and the organization's readiness to execute the plan.

controls.name: Coordinated Testing with Related Plans
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to coordinate contingency plan testing with internal and external elements responsible for related plans.

controls.name: Alternate Storage & Processing Sites
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to test contingency plans at alternate storage & processing sites to both familiarize contingency personnel with the facility and evaluate the capabilities of the alternate processing site to support contingency operations.

controls.name: Contingency Plan Root Cause Analysis (RCA) & Lessons Learned
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to conduct a Root Cause Analysis (RCA) and "lessons learned" activity every time the contingency plan is activated.

controls.name: Ongoing Contingency Planning
Contingency Planning Components
Contingency Plan Update Notifications
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to keep stakeholders informed of changes to contingency plans.

controls.name: Alternative Security Measures
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement alternative or compensating controls to satisfy security functions when the primary means of implementing the security function is unavailable or compromised.

controls.name: Alternate Storage Site
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to establish an alternate storage site that includes both the assets and necessary agreements to permit the storage and recovery of system backup information.

controls.name: Separation from Primary Site
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to separate the alternate storage site from the primary storage site to reduce susceptibility to similar threats.

controls.name: Accessibility
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and mitigate potential accessibility problems to the alternate storage site in the event of an area-wide disruption or disaster.

controls.name: Alternate Processing Site
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to establish an alternate processing site that provides security measures equivalent to that of the primary site.

controls.name: Separation from Primary Site
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to separate the alternate processing site from the primary processing site to reduce susceptibility to similar threats.

controls.name: Accessibility
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and mitigate potential accessibility problems to the alternate processing site and possible mitigation actions, in the event of an area-wide disruption or disaster.

controls.name: Alternate Site Priority of Service
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to address priority-of-service provisions in alternate processing and storage sites that support availability requirements, including Recovery Time Objectives (RTOs).

controls.name: Preparation for Use
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prepare the alternate processing alternate to support essential missions and business functions so that the alternate site is capable of being used as the primary site.

controls.name: Inability to Return to Primary Site
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to plan and prepare for both natural and manmade circumstances that preclude returning to the primary processing site.

controls.name: Telecommunications Services Availability
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to reduce the likelihood of a single point of failure with primary telecommunications services.

controls.name: Telecommunications Priority of Service Provisions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to formalize primary and alternate telecommunications service agreements contain priority-of-service provisions that support availability requirements, including Recovery Time Objectives (RTOs).

controls.name: Separation of Primary / Alternate Providers
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to obtain alternate telecommunications services from providers that are separated from primary service providers to reduce susceptibility to the same threats.

controls.name: Provider Contingency Plan
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to contractually-require external service providers to have contingency plans that meet organizational contingency requirements.

controls.name: Alternate Communications Channels
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to maintain command and control capabilities via alternate communications channels and designating alternative decision makers if primary decision makers are unavailable.

controls.name: Data Backups
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to create recurring backups of data, software and/or system images, as well as verify the integrity of these backups, to ensure the availability of the data to satisfy Recovery Time Objectives (RTOs) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPOs).

controls.name: Testing for Reliability & Integrity
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to routinely test backups that verify the reliability of the backup process, as well as the integrity and availability of the data.

controls.name: Separate Storage for Critical Information
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to store backup copies of critical software and other security-related information in a separate facility or in a fire-rated container that is not collocated with the system being backed up.

controls.name: Recovery Images
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to reimage assets from configuration-controlled and integrity-protected images that represent a secure, operational state.

controls.name: Cryptographic Protection
controls.description: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to prevent the unauthorized disclosure and/or modification of backup information.

controls.name: Test Restoration Using Sampling
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize sampling of available backups to test recovery capabilities as part of business continuity plan testing.

controls.name: Transfer to Alternate Storage Site
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to transfer backup data to the alternate storage site at a rate that is capable of meeting both Recovery Time Objectives (RTOs) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPOs).

controls.name: Redundant Secondary System
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to maintain a failover capability, which is not collocated with the primary Technology Asset, Application and/or Service (TAAS), which can be activated with little-to-no loss of information or disruption to operations.

controls.name: Dual Authorization For Backup Media Destruction
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement and enforce dual authorization for the deletion or destruction of sensitive backup media and data.

controls.name: Backup Access
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict access to backups to privileged users with assigned roles for data backup and recovery operations.

controls.name: Backup Modification and/or Destruction
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict access to modify and/or delete backups to privileged users with assigned data backup and recovery operations roles.

controls.name: Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) Recovery & Reconstitution
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure the secure recovery and reconstitution of Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) to a known state after a disruption, compromise or failure.

controls.name: Transaction Recovery
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize specialized backup mechanisms that will allow transaction recovery for transaction-based Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) in accordance with Recovery Point Objectives (RPOs).

controls.name: Failover Capability
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement real-time or near-real-time failover capability to maintain availability of critical Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD).

controls.name: Electronic Discovery (eDiscovery)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize electronic discovery (eDiscovery) that covers current and archived communication transactions.

controls.name: Restore Within Time Period
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restore Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD) within organization-defined restoration time-periods from configuration-controlled and integrity-protected information; representing a known, operational state for the asset.

controls.name: Backup & Restoration Hardware Protection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect backup and restoration hardware and software.

controls.name: Restoration Integrity Verification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to verify the integrity of backups and other restoration assets prior to using them for restoration.

controls.name: Isolated Recovery Environment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize an isolated, non-production environment to perform data backup and recovery operations through offline, cloud or off-site capabilities.

controls.name: Reserve Hardware
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to purchase and maintain a sufficient reserve of spare hardware to ensure essential missions and business functions can be maintained in the event of a supply chain disruption.

controls.name: AI & Autonomous Technologies Incidents
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to handle failures or incidents with Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomous Technologies (AAT) deemed to be high-risk.

controls.name: Capacity & Performance Management
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of capacity management controls to ensure optimal system performance to meet expected and anticipated future capacity requirements.

controls.name: Resource Priority
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to control resource utilization of Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) that are susceptible to Denial of Service (DoS) attacks to limit and prioritize the use of resources.

controls.name: Capacity Planning
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to conduct capacity planning so that necessary capacity for information processing, telecommunications and environmental support will exist during contingency operations.

controls.name: Performance Monitoring
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to centrally-monitor and alert on the operating state and health status of critical Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Elastic Expansion
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to automatically scale the resources available for Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS), as demand conditions change.

controls.name: Regional Delivery
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to support operations that are geographically dispersed via regional delivery of technological Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).
