controls.name: Change Management Program
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of a change management program.

controls.name: Configuration Change Control
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to govern the technical configuration change control processes.

controls.name: Prohibition Of Changes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prohibit unauthorized changes, unless organization-approved change requests are received.

controls.name: Test, Validate & Document Changes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to appropriately test and document proposed changes in a non-production environment before changes are implemented in a production environment.

controls.name: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Representative for Asset Lifecycle Changes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to include a cybersecurity and/or data protection representative in the configuration change control review process.

controls.name: Automated Security Response
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to implement remediation actions upon the detection of unauthorized baseline configurations change(s).

controls.name: Cryptographic Management
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to govern assets involved in providing cryptographic protections according to the organization's configuration management processes.

controls.name: Security Impact Analysis for Changes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to analyze proposed changes for potential security impacts, prior to the implementation of the change.

controls.name: Access Restriction For Change
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce configuration restrictions in an effort to restrict the ability of users to conduct unauthorized changes.

controls.name: Automated Access Enforcement / Auditing
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform after-the-fact reviews of configuration change logs to discover any unauthorized changes.

controls.name: Signed Components
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent the installation of software and firmware components without verification that the component has been digitally signed using an organization-approved certificate authority.

controls.name: Dual Authorization for Change
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce a two-person rule for implementing changes to critical Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Permissions To Implement Changes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to limit operational privileges for implementing changes.

controls.name: Library Privileges
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict software library privileges to those individuals with a pertinent business need for access.

controls.name: Stakeholder Notification of Changes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure stakeholders are made aware of and understand the impact of proposed changes.

controls.name: Control Functionality Verification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to verify the functionality of cybersecurity and data protection controls following implemented changes to ensure applicable controls operate as designed.

controls.name: Report Verification Results
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to report the results of cybersecurity and data protection function verification to appropriate organizational management.

controls.name: Emergency Changes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to govern change management procedures for "emergency" changes.

controls.name: Documenting Emergency Changes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to document the results of "emergency" changes, including an explanation for why standard change management procedures could not be followed.

controls.name: Cloud Services
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of cloud management controls to ensure cloud instances are secure and in-line with industry practices.

controls.name: Cloud Infrastructure Onboarding
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure cloud services are designed and configured so Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) are secured in accordance with applicable organizational standards, as well as statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.

controls.name: Cloud Infrastructure Offboarding
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure cloud services are decommissioned so that data is securely transitioned to new systems or archived in accordance with applicable organizational standards, as well as statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.

controls.name: Cloud Security Architecture
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure the cloud security architecture supports the organization's technology strategy to securely design, configure and maintain cloud employments.

controls.name: Cloud Infrastructure Security Subnet
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to host security-specific technologies in a dedicated subnet.

controls.name: Application Programming Interface (API) Security
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure support for secure interoperability between components with Application Programming Interfaces (APIs).

controls.name: API Gateway
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement an Application Programming Interface (API) Gateway, or similar technology, to serve as a controlled entry point that manages interactions between client-facing requests and backend services.

controls.name: Virtual Machine Images
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure the integrity of virtual machine images at all times.

controls.name: Multi-Tenant Environments
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure multi-tenant owned or managed assets (physical and virtual) are designed and governed such that provider and customer (tenant) user access is appropriately segmented from other tenant users.

controls.name: Customer Responsibility Matrix (CRM)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to formally document a Customer Responsibility Matrix (CRM), delineating assigned responsibilities for controls between the Cloud Service Provider (CSP) and its customers.

controls.name: Multi-Tenant Event Logging Capabilities
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure Multi-Tenant Service Providers (MTSP) facilitate security event logging capabilities for its customers that are consistent with applicable statutory, regulatory and/or contractual obligations.

controls.name: Multi-Tenant Forensics Capabilities
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure Multi-Tenant Service Providers (MTSP) facilitate prompt forensic investigations in the event of a suspected or confirmed security incident.

controls.name: Multi-Tenant Incident Response Capabilities
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure Multi-Tenant Service Providers (MTSP) facilitate prompt response to suspected or confirmed security incidents and vulnerabilities, including timely notification to affected customers.

controls.name: Data Handling & Portability
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure cloud providers use secure protocols for the import, export and management of data in cloud-based Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Standardized Virtualization Formats
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure interoperability by requiring cloud providers to use industry-recognized formats and provide documentation of custom changes for review.

controls.name: Geolocation Requirements for Processing, Storage and Service Locations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to control the location of cloud processing/storage based on business requirements that includes statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.

controls.name: Sensitive Data In Public Cloud Providers
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to limit and manage the storage of sensitive/regulated data in public cloud providers.

controls.name: Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize a Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB), or similar technology, to provide boundary protection and monitoring functions that both provide access to the cloud and protect the organization from misuse of cloud resources.

controls.name: Side Channel Attack Prevention
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent "side channel attacks" when using a Content Delivery Network (CDN) by restricting access to the origin server's IP address to the CDN and an authorized management network.

controls.name: Hosted Assets, Applications & Services
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to specify applicable cybersecurity and data protection controls that must be implemented on external Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS), consistent with the contractual obligations established with the External Service Providers (ESP) owning, operating and/or maintaining external TAAS.

controls.name: Authorized Individuals For Hosted Assets, Applications & Services
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to authorize specified individuals to access External Service Providers (ESP) owned, operated and/or maintained external Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Sensitive / Regulated Data On Hosted Assets, Applications & Services
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define formal processes to store, process and/or transmit sensitive/regulated data using External Service Providers (ESP) owned, operated and/or maintained external Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS), in accordance with all applicable statutory, regulatory and/or contractual obligations.

controls.name: Prohibition On Unverified Hosted Assets, Applications & Services
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prohibit access to, or usage of, hosted Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) until applicable cybersecurity and data protection control implementation is verified.

controls.name: Software Defined Storage (SDS)
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to utilize Software Defined Storage (SDS) to scale access management permissions to Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD).

controls.name: Statutory, Regulatory & Contractual Compliance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the identification and implementation of relevant statutory, regulatory and contractual controls.

controls.name: Non-Compliance Oversight
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to document and review instances of non-compliance with statutory, regulatory and/or contractual obligations to develop appropriate risk mitigation actions.

controls.name: Compliance Scope
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to document and validate the scope of cybersecurity and data protection controls that are determined to meet statutory, regulatory and/or contractual compliance obligations.

controls.name: Ability To Demonstrate Conformity
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure the organization is able to demonstrate conformity with applicable cybersecurity and data protection laws, regulations and/or contractual obligations.

controls.name: Conformity Assessment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to conduct assessments to demonstrate conformity with applicable cybersecurity and data protection laws, regulations and/or contractual obligations.

controls.name: Declaration of Conformity
Assessment Team Subject Matter Expertise
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to ensure individuals performing audits and/or assessments have reasonable:
(1) Professional qualifications to perform the audit and/or assessment; and
(2) Subject matter expertise to perform review, interview and test activities for in-scope People, Processes, Technologies, Data and/or Facilities (PPTDF).

controls.name: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Controls Oversight
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide a cybersecurity and data protection controls oversight function that reports to the organization's executive leadership.

controls.name: Internal Audit Function
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement an internal audit function that is capable of providing senior organization management with insights into the appropriateness of the organization's technology and information governance processes.

controls.name: Periodic Audits
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to conduct periodic audits of cybersecurity and data protection controls to evaluate conformity with the organization's documented policies, standards and procedures.

controls.name: Corrective Action
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to take corrective action to remediate instances of non-conformity with applicable statutory, regulatory, and/or contractual compliance obligations.

controls.name: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Assessments
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to regularly review processes and documented procedures to ensure conformity with the organization's cybersecurity and data protection policies, standards and other applicable requirements.

controls.name: Independent Assessors
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize independent assessors to evaluate cybersecurity and data protection controls at planned intervals or when the Technology Asset, Application and/or Service (TAAS) undergoes significant changes.

controls.name: Functional Review Of Cybersecurity & Data Protection Controls
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to regularly review Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) for adherence to the organization's cybersecurity and data protection policies and standards.

controls.name: Assessor Access
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to grant assessors minimum necessary access to conduct conformity assessments, including:
(1) Logical access to design, development, production, inspection and testing artifacts; and 
(2) Physical access to facilities.

controls.name: Assessment Methods
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define acceptable methods to conduct a cybersecurity and/or data protection assessment.

controls.name: Assessment Rigor
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define the level of assessment rigor necessary to conduct a cybersecurity and/or data protection assessment.

controls.name: Evidence Request List (ERL)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define an Evidence Request List (ERL) prior to the start of a cybersecurity and/or data protection assessment.

controls.name: Evidence Sampling
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define evidence sampling criteria for cybersecurity and/or data protection assessments.

controls.name: Audit Activities
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to thoughtfully plan audits by including input from operational risk and compliance partners to minimize the impact of audit-related activities on business operations.

controls.name: Legal Assessment of Investigative Inquires
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to determine whether a government agency has an applicable and valid legal basis to request data from the organization and what further steps need to be taken, if necessary.

controls.name: Investigation Request Notifications
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to notify customers about investigation request notifications, unless the applicable legal basis for a government agency's action prohibits notification (e.g., potential criminal prosecution).

controls.name: Investigation Access Restrictions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to support official investigations by provisioning government investigators with "least privileges" and "least functionality" to ensure that government investigators only have access to the Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD) needed to perform the investigation.

controls.name: Government Surveillance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to constrain the host government from having unrestricted and non-monitored access to the organization's Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD) that could potentially violate other applicable statutory, regulatory and/or contractual obligations.

controls.name: Grievances
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to govern the intake and analysis of grievances related to the organization's cybersecurity and/or data protection practices.

controls.name: Grievance Response
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to respond to legitimate grievances related to the organization's cybersecurity and/or data protection practices.

controls.name: Localized Representation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to appoint localized representation with a physical presence in localities, as required by applicable laws and/or regulations.

controls.name: Representative Powers
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to contract localized representation to perform specified functions in regard to representing statutory and/or regulatory compliance matters.

controls.name: Control Reciprocity
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define instances of control reciprocity within assessment boundaries.

controls.name: Control Inheritance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define instances of control inheritance within assessment boundaries.

controls.name: Dual Use Technology
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to govern technologies and/or data that have potential:
(1) "Dual-use capabilities for civil and military;
(2) Use by terrorists; and/or 
(3) Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD) applications.

controls.name: USML or CCL Identification
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to identify if the organization handles United States Munitions List (USML) or Commerce Control List (CCL):
(1) Items;
(2) Technical data; and/or
(3) Provides defense services.

controls.name: Export-Controlled Access Restrictions
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to restrict logical and physical access to United States (US) export-controlled data to US: 
(1) Citizens; and/or
(2) Green Card holders.

controls.name: Export Activities Documentation
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to generate detailed logs of export-controlled data including:
(1) Logical and physical access; and
(2) Export activities.

controls.name: Statement of Applicability (SOA)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to produce a Statement of Applicability (SOA), or similar document, for compliance-related scoping activities.

controls.name: Configuration Management Program
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of configuration management controls.

controls.name: Assignment of Responsibility
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement a segregation of duties for configuration management that prevents developers from performing production configuration management duties.

controls.name: Secure Baseline Configurations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to develop, document and maintain secure baseline configurations for Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) that are consistent with industry-accepted system hardening standards.

controls.name: Reviews & Updates
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to review and update baseline configurations:
(1) At least annually;
(2) When required due to so; or
(3) As part of system component installations and upgrades.

controls.name: Automated Central Management & Verification
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to govern and report on baseline configurations of Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) through Continuous Diagnostics and Mitigation (CDM), or similar technologies.

controls.name: Retention Of Previous Configurations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to retain previous versions of baseline configuration to support roll back.

controls.name: Development & Test Environment Configurations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to manage baseline configurations for development and test environments separately from operational baseline configurations to minimize the risk of unintentional changes.

controls.name: Configure Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) for High-Risk Areas
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to configure Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) utilized in high-risk areas with more restrictive baseline configurations.

controls.name: Network Device Configuration File Synchronization
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to configure network devices to synchronize startup and running configuration files.

controls.name: Approved Configuration Deviations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to document, assess risk and approve or deny deviations to standardized configurations.

controls.name: Respond To Unauthorized Changes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to respond to unauthorized changes to configuration settings as security incidents.

controls.name: Baseline Tailoring
Least Functionality
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to configure systems to provide only essential capabilities by specifically prohibiting or restricting the use of ports, protocols, and/or services.

controls.name: Periodic Review
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to periodically review system configurations to identify and disable unnecessary and/or non-secure functions, ports, protocols and services.

controls.name: Prevent Unauthorized Software Execution
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to configure systems to prevent the execution of unauthorized software programs.

controls.name: Explicitly Allow / Deny Applications
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to explicitly allow (allowlist / whitelist) and/or block (denylist / blacklist) applications that are authorized to execute on systems.

controls.name: Split Tunneling
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent split tunneling for remote devices unless the split tunnel is securely provisioned using organization-defined safeguards.

controls.name: Software Usage Restrictions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce software usage restrictions to comply with applicable contract agreements and copyright laws.

controls.name: Open Source Software
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to establish parameters for the secure use of open source software.

controls.name: Unsupported Internet Browsers & Email Clients
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to allow only approved Internet browsers and email clients to run on systems.

controls.name: User-Installed Software
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict the ability of non-privileged users to install unauthorized software.

controls.name: Unauthorized Installation Alerts
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to configure systems to generate an alert when the unauthorized installation of software is detected.

controls.name: Restrict Roles Permitted To Install Software
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to configure systems to prevent the installation of software, unless the action is performed by a privileged user or service.

controls.name: Configuration Enforcement
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to monitor, enforce and report on configurations for endpoint devices.

controls.name: Integrity Assurance & Enforcement (IAE)
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to identify unauthorized deviations from an approved baseline and implement automated resiliency actions to remediate the unauthorized change.

controls.name: Zero-Touch Provisioning (ZTP)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement Zero-Touch Provisioning (ZTP), or similar technology, to automatically and securely configure devices upon being added to a network.

controls.name: Sensitive / Regulated Data Access Enforcement
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to configure Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) to restrict access to sensitive/regulated data.

controls.name: Sensitive / Regulated Data Actions
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to generate event logs whenever sensitive/regulated data is collected, created, updated, deleted and/or archived.

controls.name: Continuous Monitoring
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of enterprise-wide monitoring controls.

controls.name: Intrusion Detection & Prevention Systems (IDS & IPS)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (IDS / IPS) technologies on critical systems, key network segments and network choke points.

controls.name: Automated Tools for Real-Time Analysis
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize a Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM), or similar automated tool, to support near real-time analysis and incident escalation.

controls.name: Inbound & Outbound Communications Traffic
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to continuously monitor inbound and outbound communications traffic for unusual or unauthorized activities or conditions.

controls.name: System Generated Alerts
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to generate, monitor, correlate and respond to alerts from physical, cybersecurity, data protection and supply chain activities to achieve integrated situational awareness.

controls.name: Wireless Intrusion Detection System (WIDS)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize Wireless Intrusion Detection / Protection Systems (WIDS / WIPS) to identify rogue wireless devices and to detect attack attempts via wireless networks.

controls.name: Host-Based Devices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize Host-based Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (HIDS / HIPS) to actively alert on or block unwanted activities and send logs to a Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM), or similar automated tool, to maintain situational awareness.

controls.name: File Integrity Monitoring (FIM)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize a File Integrity Monitor (FIM), or similar change-detection technology, on critical Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) to generate alerts for unauthorized modifications.

controls.name: Security Event Monitoring
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to review event logs on an ongoing basis and escalate incidents in accordance with established timelines and procedures.

controls.name: Proxy Logging
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to log all Internet-bound requests, in order to identify prohibited activities and assist incident handlers with identifying potentially compromised systems.

controls.name: Deactivated Account Activity
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to monitor deactivated accounts for attempted usage.

controls.name: Automated Response to Suspicious Events
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to implement pre-determined corrective actions in response to detected events that have security incident implications.

controls.name: Automated Alerts
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to automatically alert incident response personnel to inappropriate or anomalous activities that have potential security incident implications.

controls.name: Alert Threshold Tuning
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to "tune" event monitoring technologies through analyzing communications traffic/event patterns and developing profiles representing common traffic patterns and/or events.

controls.name: Individuals Posing Greater Risk
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement enhanced activity monitoring for individuals who have been identified as posing an increased level of risk.

controls.name: Privileged User Oversight
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement enhanced activity monitoring for privileged users.

controls.name: Analyze and Prioritize Monitoring Requirements
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to assess the organization's needs for monitoring and prioritize the monitoring of assets, based on asset criticality and the sensitivity of the data it stores, transmits and processes.

controls.name: Real-Time Session Monitoring
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enable authorized personnel the ability to remotely view and hear content related to an established user session in real time, in accordance with organizational standards, as well as statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.

controls.name: Centralized Collection of Security Event Logs
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize a Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM), or similar automated tool, to support the centralized collection of security-related event logs.

controls.name: Correlate Monitoring Information
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to correlate both technical and non-technical information from across the enterprise by a Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM) or similar automated tool, to enhance organization-wide situational awareness.

controls.name: Central Review & Analysis
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to centrally collect, review and analyze audit records from multiple sources.

controls.name: Integration of Scanning & Other Monitoring Information
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to integrate the analysis of audit records with analysis of vulnerability scanners, network performance, system monitoring and other sources to further enhance the ability to identify inappropriate or unusual activity.

controls.name: Correlation with Physical Monitoring
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to correlate information from audit records with information obtained from monitoring physical access to further enhance the ability to identify suspicious, inappropriate, unusual or malevolent activity.

controls.name: Permitted Actions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to specify the permitted actions for both users and Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) associated with the review, analysis and reporting of audit information.

controls.name: Audit Level Adjustments
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to adjust the level of audit review, analysis and reporting based on evolving threat information from law enforcement, industry associations or other credible sources of threat intelligence.

controls.name: System-Wide / Time-Correlated Audit Trail
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to compile audit records into an organization-wide audit trail that is time-correlated.

controls.name: Changes by Authorized Individuals
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide privileged users or roles the capability to change the auditing to be performed on specified system components, based on specific event criteria within specified time thresholds.

controls.name: Inventory of Technology Asset Event Logging
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to maintain a current and accurate inventory of technology-related Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) being logged.

controls.name: Content of Event Logs
Sensitive Audit Information
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect sensitive/regulated data contained in log files.

controls.name: Audit Trails
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to link system access to individual users or service accounts.

controls.name: Privileged Functions Logging
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to log and review the actions of users and/or services with elevated privileges.

controls.name: Verbosity Logging for Boundary Devices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to verbosely log all traffic (both allowed and blocked) arriving at network boundary devices, including firewalls, Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS) and inbound and outbound proxies.

controls.name: Limit Personal Data (PD) In Audit Records
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to limit Personal Data (PD) contained in audit records to the elements identified in the Data Privacy Risk Assessment (DPRA).

controls.name: Centralized Management of Planned Audit Record Content
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to centrally manage and configure the content required to be captured in audit records generated by organization-defined system components.

controls.name: Database Logging
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure databases produce audit records that contain sufficient information to monitor database activities.

controls.name: Event Log Storage Capacity
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to allocate and proactively manage sufficient event log storage capacity to reduce the likelihood of such capacity being exceeded.

controls.name: Response To Event Log Processing Failures
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to alert appropriate personnel in the event of a log processing failure and take actions to remedy the disruption.

controls.name: Real-Time Alerts of Event Logging Failure
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide 24x7x365 near real-time alerting capability when an event log processing failure occurs.

controls.name: Event Log Storage Capacity Alerting
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to alert appropriate personnel when the allocated volume reaches an organization-defined percentage of maximum event log storage capacity.

controls.name: Monitoring Reporting
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide an event log report generation capability to aid in detecting and assessing anomalous activities.

controls.name: Query Parameter Audits of Personal Data (PD)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide and implement the capability for auditing the parameters of user query events for data sets containing Personal Data (PD).

controls.name: Trend Analysis Reporting
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to employ trend analyses to determine if security control implementations, the frequency of continuous monitoring activities, and/or the types of activities used in the continuous monitoring process need to be modified based on empirical data.

controls.name: Time Stamps
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to configure Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) to use an authoritative time source to generate time stamps for event logs.

controls.name: Synchronization With Authoritative Time Source
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to synchronize internal system clocks with an authoritative time source.

controls.name: Protection of Event Logs
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect event logs and audit tools from unauthorized access, modification and deletion.

controls.name: Event Log Backup on Separate Physical Systems / Components
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to back up event logs onto a physically different system or system component than the Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM) or similar automated tool.

controls.name: Access by Subset of Privileged Users
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict access to the management of event logs to privileged users with a specific business need.

controls.name: Cryptographic Protection of Event Log Information
controls.description: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the integrity of event logs and audit tools.

controls.name: Dual Authorization for Event Log Movement
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to enforce dual authorization for the movement or deletion of event logs.

controls.name: Non-Repudiation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize a non-repudiation capability to protect against an individual falsely denying having performed a particular action.

controls.name: Identity Binding
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to bind the identity of the information producer to the information generated.

controls.name: Event Log Retention
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to retain event logs for a time period consistent with records retention requirements to provide support for after-the-fact investigations of security incidents and to meet statutory, regulatory and contractual retention requirements.

controls.name: Monitoring For Information Disclosure
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to monitor for evidence of unauthorized exfiltration or disclosure of non-public information.

controls.name: Analyze Traffic for Covert Exfiltration
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to analyze network traffic to detect covert data exfiltration.

controls.name: Unauthorized Network Services
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to detect unauthorized network services and alert incident response personnel.

controls.name: Monitoring for Indicators of Compromise (IOC)
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to identify and alert on Indicators of Compromise (IoC).

controls.name: Session Audit
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to provide session audit capabilities that can: 
(1) Capture and log all content related to a user session; and
(2) Remotely view all content related to an established user session in real time.

controls.name: Alternate Event Logging Capability
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide an alternate event logging capability in the event of a failure in primary audit capability.

controls.name: Cross-Organizational Monitoring
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to coordinate sanitized event logs among external organizations to identify anomalous events when event logs are shared across organizational boundaries, without giving away sensitive or critical business data.

controls.name: Sharing of Event Logs
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to share event logs with third-party organizations based on specific cross-organizational sharing agreements.

controls.name: Covert Channel Analysis
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to conduct covert channel analysis to identify aspects of communications that are potential avenues for covert channels.

controls.name: Anomalous Behavior
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize User & Entity Behavior Analytics (UEBA) and/or User Activity Monitoring (UAM) solutions to detect and respond to anomalous behavior that could indicate account compromise or other malicious activities.

controls.name: Insider Threats
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to monitor internal personnel activity for potential security incidents.

controls.name: Third-Party Threats
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to monitor third-party personnel activity for potential security incidents.

controls.name: Unauthorized Activities
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to monitor for unauthorized activities, accounts, connections, devices and software.

controls.name: Account Creation and Modification Logging
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to generate event logs for permissions changes to privileged accounts and/or groups.

controls.name: Event Log Analysis & Triage
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure event log reviews include analysis and triage practices that integrate with the organization's established incident response processes.

controls.name: Event Log Review Escalation Matrix
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to make event log review processes more efficient and effective by developing and maintaining an incident response escalation matrix.

controls.name: File Activity Monitoring (FAM)
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to monitor sensitive/regulated data in Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) and data repositories.

controls.name: Use of Cryptographic Controls
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of cryptographic protections controls using known public standards and trusted cryptographic technologies.

controls.name: Alternate Physical Protection
controls.description: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to prevent unauthorized disclosure of information as an alternative to physical safeguards.

controls.name: Export-Controlled Cryptography
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to address the exporting of cryptographic technologies in compliance with relevant statutory and regulatory requirements.

controls.name: Pre/Post Transmission Handling
controls.description: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to ensure the confidentiality and integrity of information during preparation for transmission and during reception.

controls.name: Conceal / Randomize Communications
controls.description: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to conceal or randomize communication patterns.

controls.name: Cryptographic Cipher Suites and Protocols Inventory
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify, document and review deployed cryptographic cipher suites and protocols to proactively respond to industry trends regarding the continued viability of utilized cryptographic cipher suites and protocols.

controls.name: Cryptographic Module Authentication
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to enable systems to authenticate to a cryptographic module.

controls.name: Transmission Confidentiality
controls.description: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality of data being transmitted.

controls.name: Transmission Integrity
controls.description: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the integrity of data being transmitted.

controls.name: Encrypting Data At Rest
controls.description: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to prevent unauthorized disclosure of data at rest.

controls.name: Storage Media
controls.description: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality and integrity of sensitive/regulated data residing on storage media.

controls.name: Offline Storage
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to remove unused data from online storage and archive it off-line in a secure location until it can be disposed of according to data retention requirements.

controls.name: Database Encryption
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure that database servers utilize encryption to protect the confidentiality of the data within the databases.

controls.name: Non-Console Administrative Access
controls.description: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality and integrity of non-console administrative access.

controls.name: Wireless Access Authentication & Encryption
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality and integrity of wireless networking technologies by implementing authentication and strong encryption.

controls.name: Public Key Infrastructure (PKI)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to securely implement an internal Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) infrastructure or obtain PKI services from a reputable PKI service provider.

controls.name: Availability
controls.description: Resiliency mechanisms exist to ensure the availability of data in the event of the loss of cryptographic keys.

controls.name: Cryptographic Key Management
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate cryptographic key management controls to protect the confidentiality, integrity and availability of keys.

controls.name: Symmetric Keys
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the production and management of symmetric cryptographic keys using Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS)-compliant key management technology and processes.

controls.name: Asymmetric Keys
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the production and management of asymmetric cryptographic keys using Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS)-compliant key management technology and processes that protect the users private key.

controls.name: Cryptographic Key Loss or Change
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure the availability of information in the event of the loss of cryptographic keys by individual users.

controls.name: Control & Distribution of Cryptographic Keys
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the secure distribution of symmetric and asymmetric cryptographic keys using industry recognized key management technology and processes.

controls.name: Assigned Owners
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure cryptographic keys are bound to individual identities.

controls.name: Third-Party Cryptographic Keys
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure customers are provided with appropriate key management guidance whenever cryptographic keys are shared.

controls.name: External System Cryptographic Key Control
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to maintain control of cryptographic keys for encrypted material stored or transmitted through an external system.

controls.name: Transmission of Cybersecurity & Data Protection Attributes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to associate Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) security attributes with information exchanged between TAAS.

controls.name: Certificate Authorities
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to enable the use of organization-defined Certificate Authorities (CAs) to facilitate the establishment of protected sessions.

controls.name: Certificate Monitoring
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to discover when new certificates are issued for organization-controlled domains.

controls.name: Cryptographic Hash
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize hash algorithms to generate a hash value that can be used to validate the integrity of data and/or software.

controls.name: Data Protection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of data protection controls.

controls.name: Data Stewardship
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure data stewardship is assigned, documented and communicated.

controls.name: Sensitive / Regulated Data Protection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect sensitive/regulated data wherever it is processed and/or stored.

controls.name: Sensitive / Regulated Media Records
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure media records for sensitive/regulated data contain sufficient information to determine the potential impact in the event of a data loss incident.

controls.name: Defining Access Authorizations for Sensitive / Regulated Data
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to explicitly define authorizations for specific individuals and/or roles for logical and /or physical access to sensitive/regulated data.

controls.name: Data & Asset Classification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure data and assets are categorized in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements.

controls.name: Highest Classification Level
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure that Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) are classified according to the highest level of data sensitivity that is stored, transmitted and/or processed.

controls.name: Media Access
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to control and restrict access to digital and non-digital media to authorized individuals.

controls.name: Disclosure of Information
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict the disclosure of sensitive/regulated data to authorized parties with a need to know.

controls.name: Masking Displayed Data
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to apply data masking to sensitive/regulated information that is displayed or printed.

controls.name: Controlled Release
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to validate cybersecurity and data protection attributes prior to releasing information to external Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Media Marking
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to mark media in accordance with data protection requirements so that personnel are alerted to distribution limitations, handling caveats and applicable security requirements.

controls.name: Automated Marking
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to mark physical media and digital files to indicate the distribution limitations, handling requirements and applicable security markings (if any) of the information to aid Data Loss Prevention (DLP) technologies.

controls.name: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Attributes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to bind cybersecurity and data protection attributes to information as it is stored, transmitted and processed.

controls.name: Dynamic Attribute Association
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to dynamically associate cybersecurity and data protection attributes with individuals and objects as information is created, combined, or transformed, in accordance with organization-defined cybersecurity and data protection policies.

controls.name: Attribute Value Changes By Authorized Individuals
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide authorized individuals (or processes acting on behalf of individuals) the capability to define or change the value of associated cybersecurity and data protection attributes.

controls.name: Maintenance of Attribute Associations By System
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to maintain the association and integrity of cybersecurity and data protection attributes to individuals and objects.

controls.name: Association of Attributes By Authorized Individuals
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide the capability to associate cybersecurity and data protection attributes with individuals and objects by authorized individuals (or processes acting on behalf of individuals).

controls.name: Attribute Displays for Output Devices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to display cybersecurity and data protection attributes in human-readable form on each object that the system transmits to output devices to identify special dissemination, handling or distribution instructions using human-readable, standard naming conventions.

controls.name: Data Subject Attribute Associations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to require personnel to associate and maintain the association of cybersecurity and data protection attributes with individuals and objects in accordance with cybersecurity and data protection policies.

controls.name: Consistent Attribute Interpretation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide a consistent, organizationally agreed upon interpretation of cybersecurity and data protection attributes employed in access enforcement and flow enforcement decisions between distributed system components.

controls.name: Identity Association Techniques & Technologies
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to associate cybersecurity and data protection attributes to information.

controls.name: Attribute Reassignment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to reclassify data as required, due to changing business/technical requirements.

controls.name: Attribute Configuration By Authorized Individuals
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide authorized individuals the capability to define or change the type and value of cybersecurity and data protection attributes available for association with subjects and objects.

controls.name: Audit Changes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to audit changes to cybersecurity and data protection attributes and responds to events in accordance with incident response procedures.

controls.name: Media Storage
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to: 
(1) Physically control and securely store digital and non-digital media within controlled areas using organization-defined security measures; and
(2) Protect system media until the media are destroyed or sanitized using approved equipment, techniques and procedures.

controls.name: Physically Secure All Media
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to physically secure all media that contains sensitive information.

controls.name: Sensitive Data Inventories
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to maintain inventory logs of all sensitive media and conduct sensitive media inventories at least annually.

controls.name: Periodic Scans for Sensitive / Regulated Data
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to periodically scan unstructured data sources for sensitive/regulated data or data requiring special protection measures by statutory, regulatory or contractual obligations.

controls.name: Making Sensitive Data Unreadable In Storage
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure sensitive/regulated data is rendered human unreadable anywhere sensitive/regulated data is stored.

controls.name: Storing Authentication Data
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prohibit the storage of sensitive transaction authentication data after authorization.

controls.name: Media Transportation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect and control digital and non-digital media during transport outside of controlled areas using appropriate security measures.

controls.name: Custodians
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify custodians throughout the transport of digital or non-digital media.

controls.name: Encrypting Data In Storage Media
controls.description: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality and integrity of information stored on digital media during transport outside of controlled areas.

controls.name: Physical Media Disposal
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to securely dispose of media when it is no longer required, using formal procedures.

controls.name: System Media Sanitization
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to sanitize system media with the strength and integrity commensurate with the classification or sensitivity of the information prior to disposal, release out of organizational control or release for reuse.

controls.name: System Media Sanitization Documentation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to supervise, track, document and verify system media sanitization and disposal actions.

controls.name: Equipment Testing
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to test sanitization equipment and procedures to verify that the intended result is achieved.

controls.name: Sanitization of Personal Data (PD)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the sanitization of Personal Data (PD).

controls.name: First Time Use Sanitization
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to apply nondestructive sanitization techniques to portable storage devices prior to first use.

controls.name: Dual Authorization for Sensitive Data Destruction
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce dual authorization for the destruction, disposal or sanitization of digital media that contains sensitive/regulated data.

controls.name: Media Use
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict the use of types of digital media on systems or system components.

controls.name: Limitations on Use
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict the use and distribution of sensitive/regulated data.

controls.name: Prohibit Use Without Owner
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prohibit the use of portable storage devices in organizational systems when such devices have no identifiable owner.

controls.name: Data Reclassification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to reclassify data, including associated Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS), commensurate with the security category and/or classification level of the information.

controls.name: Removable Media Security
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict removable media in accordance with data handling and acceptable usage parameters.

controls.name: Use of External Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to govern how external parties, including Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS), are used to securely store, process and transmit data.

controls.name: Limits of Authorized Use
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to prohibit external parties, including Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS), from storing, processing and transmitting data unless authorized individuals first: 
(1) Verifying the implementation of required security controls; or
(2) Retaining a processing agreement with the entity hosting the external TAAS.

controls.name: Portable Storage Devices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict or prohibit the use of portable storage devices by users on external systems.

controls.name: Protecting Sensitive / Regulated Data on External Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure that the requirements for the protection of sensitive/regulated data processed, stored or transmitted on external Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS), are implemented in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.

controls.name: Non-Organizationally Owned Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict the use of non-organizationally owned Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) to process, store or transmit organizational information.

controls.name: Information Sharing
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize a process to assist users in making information sharing decisions to ensure data is appropriately protected.

controls.name: Information Search & Retrieval
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) implement data search and retrieval functions that properly enforce data protection / sharing restrictions.

controls.name: Transfer Authorizations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to verify that individuals or Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) transferring data between interconnecting TAAS have the requisite authorizations (e.g., write permissions or privileges) prior to transferring said data.

controls.name: Data Access Mapping
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to leverage data-specific Access Control Lists (ACL) or Interconnection Security Agreements (ISAs) to generate a logical map of the parties with whom sensitive/regulated data is shared.

controls.name: Publicly Accessible Content
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to control publicly-accessible content.

controls.name: Data Mining Protection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect data storage objects against unauthorized data mining and data harvesting techniques.

controls.name: Ad-Hoc Transfers
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to secure ad-hoc exchanges of large digital files with internal or external parties.

controls.name: Media & Data Retention
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to retain media and data in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.

controls.name: Minimize Sensitive / Regulated Data
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to minimize sensitive/regulated data that is collected, received, processed, stored and/or transmitted throughout the information lifecycle to only those elements necessary to support necessary business processes.

controls.name: Limit Sensitive / Regulated Data In Testing, Training & Research
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to minimize the use of sensitive/regulated data for research, testing, or training, in accordance with authorized, legitimate business practices.

controls.name: Temporary Files Containing Personal Data (PD)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform periodic checks of temporary files for the existence of Personal Data (PD).

controls.name: Geographic Location of Data
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to inventory, document and maintain data flows for data that is resident (permanently or temporarily) within a service's geographically distributed applications (physical and virtual), infrastructure, systems components and/or shared with other third-parties.

controls.name: Archived Data Sets
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect archived data in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.

controls.name: Information Disposal
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to securely dispose of, destroy or erase information.

controls.name: Data Quality Operations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to check for Redundant, Obsolete/Outdated, Toxic or Trivial (ROTT) data to ensure the accuracy, relevance, timeliness, impact, completeness and de-identification of information throughout the information lifecycle.

controls.name: Updating & Correcting Personal Data (PD)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize technical controls to correct Personal Data (PD) that is inaccurate or outdated, incorrectly determined regarding impact, or incorrectly de-identified.

controls.name: Data Tags
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize data tags to automate tracking of sensitive/regulated data across the information lifecycle.

controls.name: Primary Source Personal Data (PD) Collection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to collect Personal Data (PD) directly from the individual.

controls.name: De-Identification (Anonymization)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to anonymize data by removing Personal Data (PD) from datasets.

controls.name: De-Identify Dataset Upon Collection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to de-identify the dataset upon collection by not collecting Personal Data (PD).

controls.name: Archiving
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to refrain from archiving Personal Data (PD) elements if those elements in a dataset will not be needed after the dataset is archived.

controls.name: Release
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to remove Personal Data (PD) elements from a dataset prior to its release if those elements in the dataset do not need to be part of the data release.

controls.name: Removal, Masking, Encryption, Hashing or Replacement of Direct Identifiers
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to remove, mask, encrypt, hash or replace direct identifiers in a dataset.

controls.name: Statistical Disclosure Control
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to manipulate numerical data, contingency tables and statistical findings so that no person or organization is identifiable in the results of the analysis.

controls.name: Differential Data Privacy
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent disclosure of Personal Data (PD) by adding non-deterministic noise to the results of mathematical operations before the results are reported.

controls.name: Automated De-Identification of Sensitive Data
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform de-identification of sensitive/regulated data, using validated algorithms and software to implement the algorithms.

controls.name: Motivated Intruder
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform a motivated intruder test on the de-identified dataset to determine if the identified data remains or if the de-identified data can be re-identified.

controls.name: Code Names
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to use aliases to name assets, which are mission-critical and/or contain highly-sensitive/regulated data, are unique and not readily associated with a product, project or type of data.

controls.name: Information Location
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and document the location of information and the specific system components on which the information resides.

controls.name: Automated Tools to Support Information Location
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to identify by data classification type to ensure adequate cybersecurity and data protection controls are in place to protect organizational information and individual data protection.

controls.name: Transfer of Sensitive and/or Regulated Data
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict and govern the transfer of sensitive and/or regulated data to third-countries or international organizations.

controls.name: Transfer Activity Limits
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to establish organization-defined "normal business activities" to identify anomalous transaction activities that can reduce the opportunity for sending (outbound) and/or receiving (inbound) fraudulent actions.

controls.name: Data Localization
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to constrain the impact of "digital sovereignty laws," that require localized data within the host country, where data and processes may be subjected to arbitrary enforcement actions that potentially violate other applicable statutory, regulatory and/or contractual obligations.

controls.name: Data Rights Management (DRM)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize Data Rights Management (DRM), or similar technologies, to protect Intellectual Property (IP) rights by preventing the unauthorized distribution and/or modification of sensitive IP.

controls.name: Embedded Technology Security Program
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of embedded technology controls.

controls.name: Internet of Things (IOT)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to proactively manage the cybersecurity and data protection risks associated with Internet of Things (IoT).

controls.name: Operational Technology (OT)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to proactively manage the cybersecurity and data protection risks associated with Operational Technology (OT).

controls.name: Interface Security
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect embedded devices against unauthorized use of the physical factory diagnostic and test interface(s).

controls.name: Embedded Technology Configuration Monitoring
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to generate log entries on embedded devices when configuration changes or attempts to access interfaces are detected.

controls.name: Prevent Alterations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect embedded devices by preventing the unauthorized installation and execution of software.

controls.name: Embedded Technology Maintenance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to securely update software and upgrade functionality on embedded devices.

controls.name: Resilience To Outages
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to configure embedded technology to be resilient to data network and power outages.

controls.name: Power Level Monitoring
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to monitor the power levels of embedded technologies for decreased or excessive power usage, including battery drainage, to investigate for device tampering.

controls.name: Embedded Technology Reviews
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform evaluations of deployed embedded technologies as needed, or at least on an annual basis, to ensure that necessary updates to mitigate the risks associated with legacy embedded technologies are identified and implemented.

controls.name: Message Queuing Telemetry Transport (MQTT) Security
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce the security of Message Queuing Telemetry Transport (MQTT) traffic.

controls.name: Restrict Communications
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to require embedded technologies to initiate all communications and drop new, incoming communications.

controls.name: Authorized Communications
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict embedded technologies to communicate only with authorized peers and service endpoints.

controls.name: Operating Environment Certification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to determine if embedded technologies are certified for secure use in the proposed operating environment.

controls.name: Safety Assessment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to evaluate the safety aspects of embedded technologies via a fault tree analysis, or similar method, to determine possible consequences of misuse, misconfiguration and/or failure.

controls.name: Certificate-Based Authentication
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce certificate-based authentication for embedded technologies (e.g., IoT, OT, etc.) and their supporting services.

controls.name: Chip-To-Cloud Security
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement embedded technologies that utilize pre-provisioned cloud trust anchors to support secure bootstrap and Zero Touch Provisioning (ZTP).

controls.name: Real-Time Operating System (RTOS) Security
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure embedded technologies utilize a securely configured Real-Time Operating System (RTOS).

controls.name: Safe Operations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to continuously validate autonomous systems that trigger an automatic state change when safe operation is no longer assured.

controls.name: Endpoint Device Management (EDM)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of Endpoint Device Management (EDM) controls.

controls.name: Unified Endpoint Device Management (UEDM)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize a centralized Unified Endpoint Device Management (UEDM) solution that provides agent and/or agentless management of endpoint devices regardless of device location.

controls.name: Endpoint Protection Measures
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality, integrity, availability and safety of endpoint devices.

controls.name: Prohibit Installation Without Privileged Status
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to prohibit software installations without explicitly assigned privileged status.

controls.name: Software Installation Alerts
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to generate an alert when new software is detected.

controls.name: Governing Access Restriction for Change
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define, document, approve and enforce access restrictions associated with changes to Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Malicious Code Protection (Anti-Malware)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize antimalware technologies to detect and eradicate malicious code.

controls.name: Automatic Antimalware Signature Updates
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to update antimalware technologies, including signature definitions.

controls.name: Documented Protection Measures
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to document antimalware technologies.

controls.name: Centralized Management of Antimalware Technologies
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to centrally-manage antimalware technologies.

controls.name: Heuristic / Nonsignature-Based Detection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize heuristic / nonsignature-based antimalware detection capabilities.

controls.name: Malware Protection Mechanism Testing
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to test antimalware technologies by introducing a known benign, non-spreading test case into the system and subsequently verifying that both detection of the test case and associated incident reporting occurs.

controls.name: Evolving Malware Threats
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform periodic evaluations evolving malware threats to assess systems that are generally not considered to be commonly affected by malicious software.

controls.name: Always On Protection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure that anti-malware technologies are continuously running in real-time and cannot be disabled or altered by non-privileged users, unless specifically authorized by management on a case-by-case basis for a limited time period.

controls.name: Software Firewall
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize host-based firewall software, or a similar technology, on all endpoint devices, where technically feasible.

controls.name: Endpoint File Integrity Monitoring (FIM)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize File Integrity Monitor (FIM), or similar technologies, to detect and report on unauthorized changes to selected files and configuration settings.

controls.name: Integrity Checks
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to validate configurations through integrity checking of software and firmware.

controls.name: Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to detect and respond to unauthorized configuration changes as cybersecurity incidents.

controls.name: Automated Notifications of Integrity Violations
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to alert incident response personnel upon discovering discrepancies during integrity verification.

controls.name: Automated Response to Integrity Violations
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to implement remediation actions when integrity violations are discovered.

controls.name: Boot Process Integrity
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to verify the integrity of the boot process of systems.

controls.name: Protection of Boot Firmware
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to protect the integrity of boot firmware in systems.

controls.name: Binary or Machine-Executable Code
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prohibit the use of binary or machine-executable code from sources with limited or no warranty and without access to source code.

controls.name: Extended Detection & Response (XDR)
Host Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems (HIDS / HIPS)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize Host-based Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (HIDS / HIPS), or similar technologies, to monitor for and protect against anomalous host activity, including lateral movement across the network.

controls.name: Phishing & Spam Protection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize anti-phishing and spam protection technologies to detect and take action on unsolicited messages transported by electronic mail.

controls.name: Central Management
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to centrally-manage anti-phishing and spam protection technologies.

controls.name: Automatic Spam and Phishing Protection Updates
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to automatically update anti-phishing and spam protection technologies when new releases are available in accordance with configuration and change management practices.

controls.name: Trusted Path
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to establish a trusted communications path between the user and the security functions of the operating system.

controls.name: Mobile Code
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to address mobile code / operating system-independent applications.

controls.name: Thin Nodes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to configure thin nodes to have minimal functionality and information storage.

controls.name: Port & Input / Output (I/O) Device Access
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to physically disable or remove unnecessary connection ports or input/output devices from sensitive systems.

controls.name: Sensor Capability
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to configure embedded sensors on systems to: 
(1) Prohibit the remote activation of sensing capabilities; and
(2) Provide an explicit indication of sensor use to users.

controls.name: Authorized Use
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize organization-defined measures so that data or information collected by sensors is only used for authorized purposes.

controls.name: Notice of Collection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to notify individuals that Personal Data (PD) is collected by sensors.

controls.name: Collection Minimization
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize sensors that are configured to minimize the collection of information about individuals.

controls.name: Sensor Delivery Verification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to verify embedded technology sensors are configured so that data collected by the sensor(s) is only reported to authorized individuals or roles.

controls.name: Collaborative Computing Devices
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to unplug or prohibit the remote activation of collaborative computing devices with the following exceptions: 
(1) Networked whiteboards; 
(2) Video teleconference cameras; and 
(3) Teleconference microphones.

controls.name: Disabling / Removal In Secure Work Areas
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to disable or remove collaborative computing devices from critical systems and secure work areas.

controls.name: Explicitly Indicate Current Participants
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to provide an explicit indication of current participants in online meetings and teleconferences.

controls.name: Participant Identity Verification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to verify individual identities to ensure that access to virtual meetings is limited to appropriate individuals.

controls.name: Participant Connection Management
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure the meeting host can positively control an individual's participation in virtual meetings.

controls.name: Malicious Link & File Protections
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to detect malicious links and/or files in communications and prevent users from accessing those malicious links and/or files.

controls.name: Explicit Indication Of Use
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to configure collaborative computing devices to provide physically-present individuals with an explicit indication of use.

controls.name: Hypervisor Access
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict access to hypervisor management functions or administrative consoles for systems hosting virtualized systems.

controls.name: Restrict Access To Security Functions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure security functions are restricted to authorized individuals and enforce least privilege control requirements for necessary job functions.

controls.name: Host-Based Security Function Isolation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement underlying software separation mechanisms to facilitate security function isolation.

controls.name: Human Resources Security Management
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of personnel security controls.

controls.name: Onboarding, Transferring & Offboarding Personnel
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to proactively govern the following personnel management actions:
(1) Onboarding new personnel (e.g., new hires);
(2) Transferring personnel into new roles within the organization; and 
(3) Offboarding personnel (e.g., termination of employment).

controls.name: Position Categorization
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to manage personnel security risk by assigning a risk designation to all positions and establishing screening criteria for individuals filling those positions.

controls.name: Users With Elevated Privileges
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure that every user accessing Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) that process, store and/or transmit sensitive/regulated data is cleared and regularly trained to handle the information in question.

controls.name: Probationary Periods
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify newly onboarded personnel for enhanced monitoring during their probationary period.

controls.name: Defined Roles & Responsibilities
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define cybersecurity roles & responsibilities for all personnel.

controls.name: User Awareness
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to communicate with users about their roles and responsibilities to maintain a safe and secure working environment.

controls.name: Competency Requirements for Security-Related Positions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure that all security-related positions are staffed by qualified individuals who have the necessary skill set.

controls.name: Personnel Screening
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to manage personnel security risk by screening individuals prior to authorizing access.

controls.name: Roles With Special Protection Measures
