controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure that individuals accessing a system that stores, transmits or processes information requiring special protection satisfy organization-defined personnel screening criteria.

controls.name: Formal Indoctrination
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to formally educate authorized users on proper data handling practices for all the relevant types of data to which they have access.

controls.name: Citizenship Requirements
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to verify that individuals accessing a system processing, storing, or transmitting sensitive information meet applicable statutory, regulatory and/or contractual requirements for citizenship.

controls.name: Citizenship Identification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify foreign nationals, including by their specific citizenship.

controls.name: Terms of Employment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to require all employees and contractors to apply cybersecurity and data protection principles in their daily work.

controls.name: Rules of Behavior
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define acceptable and unacceptable rules of behavior for the use of technologies, including consequences for unacceptable behavior.

controls.name: Social Media & Social Networking Restrictions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define rules of behavior that contain explicit restrictions on the use of social media and networking sites, posting information on commercial websites and sharing account information.

controls.name: Technology Use Restrictions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to establish usage restrictions and implementation guidance for organizational technologies based on the potential to cause damage to Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS), if used maliciously.

controls.name: Use of Critical Technologies
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to govern usage policies for critical technologies.

controls.name: Use of Mobile Devices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to manage business risks associated with permitting mobile device access to organizational resources.

controls.name: Security-Minded Dress Code
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prohibit the use of oversized clothing (e.g., baggy pants, oversized hooded sweatshirts, etc.) to prevent the unauthorized exfiltration of data and technology assets.

controls.name: Policy Familiarization & Acknowledgement
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure personnel receive recurring familiarization with the organization's cybersecurity and data protection policies and provide acknowledgement.

controls.name: Access Agreements
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to require internal and third-party users to sign appropriate access agreements prior to being granted access.

controls.name: Confidentiality Agreements
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to require Non-Disclosure Agreements (NDAs) or similar confidentiality agreements that reflect the needs to protect data and operational details, or both employees and third-parties.

controls.name: Post-Employment Requirements Awareness
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to notify individuals of their applicable, legally-binding post-employment requirements for the protection of sensitive/regulated data.

controls.name: Personnel Sanctions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to sanction personnel failing to comply with established security policies, standards and procedures.

controls.name: Workplace Investigations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to conduct employee misconduct investigations when there is reasonable assurance that a policy has been violated.

controls.name: Updating Disciplinary Processes
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to periodically review and, where appropriate, update disciplinary practices due to:
(1) Legal changes;
(2) Significant changes to operations; and
(3) Applicable threats and risks.

controls.name: Preventative Access Restriction
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to proactively restrict logical and physical access when an individual with access to sensitive/regulated data is under investigation for personnel sanctions that may lead to employment termination.

controls.name: Personnel Transfer
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to adjust logical and physical access authorizations to Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) and facilities upon personnel reassignment or transfer, in a timely manner.

controls.name: Personnel Termination
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to govern the termination of individual employment.

controls.name: Asset Collection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to retrieve organization-owned assets upon termination of an individual's employment.

controls.name: High-Risk Terminations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to expedite the process of removing "high risk" individuals access to Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD) upon termination, as determined by management.

controls.name: Post-Employment Requirements Notification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to govern former employee behavior by formally notifying terminated individuals of their applicable, legally binding post-employment requirements for the protection of sensitive/regulated data.

controls.name: Automated Employment Status Notifications
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to notify Identity and Access Management (IAM) personnel or roles upon termination of an individual employment or contract.

controls.name: Third-Party Personnel Security
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to govern third-party personnel by reviewing and monitoring third-party cybersecurity and data protection roles and responsibilities.

controls.name: Separation of Duties (SoD)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement and maintain Separation of Duties (SoD) to prevent potential inappropriate activity without collusion.

controls.name: Incompatible Roles
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to avoid incompatible development-specific roles through limiting and reviewing developer privileges to change hardware, software and firmware components within a production/operational environment.

controls.name: Two-Person Rule
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce a two-person rule for implementing changes to sensitive Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Identify Critical Skills & Gaps
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to evaluate the critical cybersecurity and data protection skills needed to support the organization's mission and identify gaps that exist.

controls.name: Remediate Identified Skills Deficiencies
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to remediate critical skills deficiencies necessary to support the organization's mission and business functions.

controls.name: Identify Vital Cybersecurity & Data Privacy Staff
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify vital cybersecurity and data privacy staff.

controls.name: Establish Redundancy for Vital Cybersecurity & Data Privacy Staff
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to establish redundancy for vital cybersecurity and data privacy staff.

controls.name: Perform Succession Planning
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform succession planning for vital cybersecurity and data privacy roles.

controls.name: Identifying Authorized Work Locations
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to identify and document authorized working locations, including:
(1) Designated on-premises, organization-controlled work locations; and
(2) Other off-premises locations not under organization-control (e.g., work from home).

controls.name: Communicating Authorized Work Locations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to communicate authorized work locations to organizational personnel.

controls.name: Reporting Suspicious Activities
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enable personnel to report suspicious activities and/or behavior without fear of reprisal or other negative consequences (e.g., whistleblower protections).

controls.name: Identity & Access Management (IAM)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of identification and access management controls.

controls.name: Retain Access Records
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to retain a record of personnel accountability to ensure there is a record of all access granted to an individual (system and application-wise), who provided the authorization, when the authorization was granted and when the access was last reviewed.

controls.name: Authenticate, Authorize and Audit (AAA)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to strictly govern the use of Authenticate, Authorize and Audit (AAA) solutions, both on-premises and those hosted by an External Service Provider (ESP).

controls.name: User & Service Account Inventories
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to maintain a current list of authorized users and service accounts.

controls.name: Identification & Authentication for Organizational Users
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to uniquely identify and centrally Authenticate, Authorize and Audit (AAA) organizational users and processes acting on behalf of organizational users.

controls.name: Group Authentication
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to require individuals to be authenticated with an individual authenticator when a group authenticator is utilized.

controls.name: Replay-Resistant Authentication
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to employ replay-resistant authentication.

controls.name: Acceptance of PIV Credentials
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to accept and electronically verify organizational Personal Identity Verification (PIV) credentials.

controls.name: Out-of-Band Authentication (OOBA)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement Out-of-Band Authentication (OOBA) under specific conditions.

controls.name: Identification & Authentication for Non-Organizational Users
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to uniquely identify and centrally Authenticate, Authorize and Audit (AAA) third-party users and processes that provide services to the organization.

controls.name: Acceptance of PIV Credentials from Other Organizations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to accept and electronically verify Personal Identity Verification (PIV) credentials from third-parties.

controls.name: Acceptance of Third-Party Credentials
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to accept Federal Identity, Credential and Access Management (FICAM)-approved third-party credentials.

controls.name: Use of FICAM-Issued Profiles
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to conform systems to Federal Identity, Credential and Access Management (FICAM)-issued profiles.

controls.name: Disassociability
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to disassociate user attributes or credential assertion relationships among individuals, credential service providers and relying parties.

controls.name: Acceptance of External Authenticators
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict the use of external authenticators to those that are National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)-compliant and maintain a list of accepted external authenticators.

controls.name: Identification & Authentication for Devices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to uniquely identify and centrally Authenticate, Authorize and Audit (AAA) devices before establishing a connection using bidirectional authentication that is cryptographically- based and replay resistant.

controls.name: Device Attestation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure device identification and authentication is accurate by centrally-managing the joining of systems to the domain as part of the initial asset configuration management process.

controls.name: Device Authorization Enforcement
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce cryptographic communications keys to prevent one key from being used to access multiple devices.

controls.name: Identification & Authentication for Third-Party Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and authenticate third-party Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Sharing Identification & Authentication Information
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure external service providers provide current and accurate information for any third-party user with access to the organization's data or assets.

controls.name: Privileged Access by Non-Organizational Users
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prohibit privileged access by non-organizational users.

controls.name: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
controls.description:
Automated mechanisms exist to enforce Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for:
(1) Remote network access; 
(2) Third-party Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS); and/ or
(3) Non-console access to critical TAAS that store, transmit and/or process sensitive/regulated data.

controls.name: Network Access to Privileged Accounts
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) to authenticate network access for privileged accounts.

controls.name: Network Access to Non-Privileged Accounts
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) to authenticate network access for non-privileged accounts.

controls.name: Local Access to Privileged Accounts
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) to authenticate local access for privileged accounts.

controls.name: Out-of-Band Multi-Factor Authentication
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for access to privileged and non-privileged accounts such that one of the factors is independently provided by a device separate from the system being accessed.

controls.name: Alternative Multi-Factor Authentication
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enable alternative Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) tokens when the primary MFA solution is not able to be used.

controls.name: User Provisioning & De-Provisioning
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize a formal user registration and de-registration process that governs the assignment of access rights.

controls.name: Change of Roles & Duties
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to revoke user access rights following changes in personnel roles and duties, if no longer necessary or permitted.

controls.name: Termination of Employment
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to revoke user access rights in a timely manner, upon termination of employment or contract.

controls.name: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) for Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD) to restrict access to individuals assigned specific roles with legitimate business needs.

controls.name: Identifier Management (User Names)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to govern naming standards for usernames and Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: User Identity (ID) Management
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure proper user identification management for non-consumer users and administrators.

controls.name: Identity User Status
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify contractors and other third-party users through unique username characteristics.

controls.name: Dynamic Management
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to dynamically manage usernames and system identifiers.

controls.name: Cross-Organization Management
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to coordinate username identifiers with external organizations for cross-organization management of identifiers.

controls.name: Privileged Account Identifiers
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to uniquely manage privileged accounts to identify the account as a privileged user or service.

controls.name: Pairwise Pseudonymous Identifiers (PPID)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to generate pairwise pseudonymous identifiers with no identifying information about a data subject to discourage activity tracking and profiling of the data subject.

controls.name: Authenticator Management
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to:
(1) Securely manage authenticators for users and devices; and
(2) Ensure the strength of authentication is appropriate to the classification of the data being accessed.

controls.name: Password-Based Authentication
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce complexity, length and lifespan considerations to ensure strong criteria for password-based authentication.

controls.name: PKI-Based Authentication
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to validate certificates by constructing and verifying a certification path to an accepted trust anchor including checking certificate status information for PKI-based authentication.

controls.name: In-Person or Trusted Third-Party Registration
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to conduct in-person or trusted third-party identify verification before user accounts for third-parties are created.

controls.name: Automated Support For Password Strength
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to determine if password authenticators are sufficiently strong enough to satisfy organization-defined password length and complexity requirements.

controls.name: Protection of Authenticators
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect authenticators commensurate with the sensitivity of the information to which use of the authenticator permits access.

controls.name: No Embedded Unencrypted Static Authenticators
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure that unencrypted, static authenticators are not embedded in applications, scripts or stored on function keys.

controls.name: Hardware Token-Based Authentication
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to ensure organization-defined token quality requirements are satisfied for hardware token-based authentication.

controls.name: Default Authenticators
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure default authenticators are changed as part of account creation or system installation.

controls.name: Multiple System Accounts
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement security safeguards to manage the risk of compromise due to individuals having accounts on multiple Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Expiration of Cached Authenticators
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to prohibit the use of cached authenticators after organization-defined time period.

controls.name: Password Managers
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect and store passwords via a password manager tool.

controls.name: Biometric Authentication
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure biometric-based authentication satisfies organization-defined biometric quality requirements for false positives and false negatives.

controls.name: Events Requiring Authenticator Change
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to change authentication credentials:
(1) At predefined intervals; and/or
(2) Upon suspicion of credential compromise.

controls.name: Passkeys
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize passkeys, or equivalent cryptographic key pairing technologies, to authenticate users to Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Authenticator Feedback
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to obscure the feedback of authentication information during the authentication process to protect the information from possible exploitation/use by unauthorized individuals.

controls.name: Cryptographic Module Authentication
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure cryptographic modules adhere to applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements for security strength.

controls.name: Hardware Security Modules (HSM)
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to utilize Hardware Security Modules (HSM) to protect authenticators on which the component relies.

controls.name: Adaptive Identification & Authentication
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to allow individuals to utilize alternative methods of authentication under specific circumstances or situations.

controls.name: Single Sign-On (SSO) Transparent Authentication
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide a transparent authentication (e.g., Single Sign-On (SSO)) capability to the organization's Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Federated Credential Management
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to federate credentials to allow cross-organization authentication of individuals and devices.

controls.name: Continuous Authentication
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to enable continuous re-authentication through the lifecycle of entity interactions.

controls.name: Re-Authentication
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to force users and devices to re-authenticate according to organization-defined circumstances that necessitate re-authentication.

controls.name: Account Management
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to proactively govern account management of individual, group, system, service, application, guest and temporary accounts.

controls.name: Automated System Account Management (Directory Services)
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to support the management of system accounts (e.g., directory services).

controls.name: Removal of Temporary / Emergency Accounts
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to disable or remove temporary and emergency accounts after an organization-defined time period for each type of account.

controls.name: Disable Inactive Accounts
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to disable inactive accounts after an organization-defined time period.

controls.name: Automated Audit Actions
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to audit account creation, modification, enabling, disabling and removal actions and notify organization-defined personnel or roles.

controls.name: Restrictions on Shared Groups / Accounts
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to authorize the use of shared/group accounts only under certain organization-defined conditions.

controls.name: Account Disabling for High Risk Individuals
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to disable accounts immediately upon notification for users posing a significant risk to the organization.

controls.name: System Account Reviews
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to review all system accounts and disable any account that cannot be associated with a business process and owner.

controls.name: Usage Conditions
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to enforce usage conditions for users and/or roles.

controls.name: Emergency Accounts
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to establish and control "emergency access only" accounts.

controls.name: Privileged Account Management (PAM)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict and control privileged access rights for users and Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Privileged Account Inventories
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to inventory all privileged accounts and validate that each person with elevated privileges is authorized by the appropriate level of organizational management.

controls.name: Privileged Account Separation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to separate privileged accounts between infrastructure environments to reduce the risk of a compromise in one infrastructure environment from laterally affecting other infrastructure environments.

controls.name: Privileged Command Execution
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure privilege change requests require additional levels of authentication.

controls.name: Dedicated Privileged Account
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to assign dedicated privileged user accounts to be used solely for duties requiring privileged access.

controls.name: Periodic Review of Account Privileges
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to periodically-review the privileges assigned to individuals and service accounts to validate the need for such privileges and reassign or remove unnecessary privileges, as necessary.

controls.name: User Responsibilities for Account Management
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to compel users to follow accepted practices in the use of authentication mechanisms (e.g., passwords, passphrases, physical or logical security tokens, smart cards, certificates, etc.).

controls.name: Credential Sharing
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent the sharing of generic IDs, passwords or other generic authentication methods.

controls.name: Access Enforcement
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce Logical Access Control (LAC) permissions that conform to the principle of "least privilege."

controls.name: Access To Sensitive / Regulated Data
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to limit access to sensitive/regulated data to only those individuals whose job requires such access.

controls.name: Database Access
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict access to databases containing sensitive/regulated data to only necessary Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) or those individuals whose job requires such access.

controls.name: Use of Privileged Utility Programs
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict and tightly control utility programs that are capable of overriding system and application controls.

controls.name: Dedicated Administrative Machines
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict executing administrative tasks or tasks requiring elevated access to a dedicated machine.

controls.name: Dual Authorization for Privileged Commands
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to enforce dual authorization for privileged commands.

controls.name: Revocation of Access Authorizations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to revoke logical and physical access authorizations.

controls.name: Authorized System Accounts
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define and document the types of accounts allowed and prohibited on Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Least Privilege
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize the concept of least privilege, allowing only authorized access to processes necessary to accomplish assigned tasks in accordance with organizational business functions.

controls.name: Authorize Access to Security Functions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to limit access to security functions to explicitly-authorized privileged users.

controls.name: Non-Privileged Access for Non-Security Functions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prohibit privileged users from using privileged accounts, while performing non-security functions.

controls.name: Management Approval For Privileged Accounts
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict the assignment of privileged accounts to management-approved personnel and/or roles.

controls.name: Auditing Use of Privileged Functions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to audit the execution of privileged functions.

controls.name: Prohibit Non-Privileged Users from Executing Privileged Functions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions to include disabling, circumventing or altering implemented security safeguards / countermeasures.

controls.name: Network Access to Privileged Commands
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to authorize remote access to perform privileged commands on critical Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) or where sensitive/regulated data is stored, transmitted and/or processed only for compelling operational needs.

controls.name: Privilege Levels for Code Execution
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to prevent applications from executing at higher privilege levels than the user's privileges.

controls.name: Account Lockout
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce a limit for consecutive invalid login attempts by a user during an organization-defined time period and automatically locks the account when the maximum number of unsuccessful attempts is exceeded.

controls.name: Concurrent Session Control
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to limit the number of concurrent sessions for each system account.

controls.name: Session Lock
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to initiate a session lock after an organization-defined time period of inactivity, or upon receiving a request from a user and retain the session lock until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication methods.

controls.name: Pattern-Hiding Displays
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement pattern-hiding displays to conceal information previously visible on the display during the session lock.

controls.name: Session Termination
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to log out users, both locally on the network and for remote sessions, at the end of the session or after an organization-defined period of inactivity.

controls.name: User-Initiated Logouts / Message Displays
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide a logout capability and display an explicit logout message to users indicating the reliable termination of the session.

controls.name: Permitted Actions Without Identification or Authorization
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and document the supporting rationale for specific user actions that can be performed on a system without identification or authentication.

controls.name: Reference Monitor
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement a reference monitor that is tamperproof, always-invoked, small enough to be subject to analysis / testing and the completeness of which can be assured.

controls.name: Identity Proofing (Identity Verification)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to verify the identity of a user before issuing authenticators or modifying access permissions.

controls.name: Management Approval For New or Changed Accounts
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure management approvals are required for new accounts or changes in permissions to existing accounts.

controls.name: Identity Evidence
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to require evidence of individual identification to be presented to the registration authority.

controls.name: Identity Evidence Validation & Verification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to require that the presented identity evidence be validated and verified through organizational-defined methods of validation and verification.

controls.name: In-Person Validation & Verification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to require that the validation and verification of identity evidence be conducted in person before a designated registration authority.

controls.name: Address Confirmation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to require that a notice of proofing be delivered through an out-of-band channel to verify the user's address (physical or digital).

controls.name: Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) for policy-driven, dynamic authorizations that supports the secure sharing of information.

controls.name: Real-Time Access Decisions
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to utilize Machine Learning (ML) to make real-time access decisions based on advanced network analytics that leverages enterprise-wide data sources.

controls.name: Access Profile Rules
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to develop access profile rules for sensitive/regulated Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD) access based on User, Data, Network, Environment & Device attributes.

controls.name: Incident Response Operations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement and govern processes and documentation to facilitate an organization-wide response capability for cybersecurity and data protection-related incidents.

controls.name: Incident Handling
Automated Incident Handling Processes
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to support the incident handling process.

controls.name: Insider Threat Response Capability
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement and govern an insider threat program.

controls.name: Dynamic Reconfiguration
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to dynamically reconfigure system components as part of the incident response capability.

controls.name: Incident Classification & Prioritization
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify classes of incidents and actions to take to ensure the continuation of organizational missions and business functions.

controls.name: Correlation with External Organizations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to coordinate with approved third-parties to achieve a cross-organization perspective on incident awareness and more effective incident responses.

controls.name: Automatic Disabling of Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to automatically disable Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS), upon detection of a possible incident that meets organizational criteria, which allows for forensic analysis to be performed.

controls.name: Indicators of Compromise (IOC)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define specific Indicators of Compromise (IOC) to identify the signs of potential cybersecurity events.

controls.name: Incident Response Plan (IRP)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to maintain and make available a current and viable Incident Response Plan (IRP) to all stakeholders.

controls.name: Data Breach
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to address data breaches, or other incidents involving the unauthorized disclosure of sensitive or regulated data, according to applicable laws, regulations and contractual obligations.

controls.name: IRP Update
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to regularly review and modify incident response practices to incorporate lessons learned, business process changes and industry developments, as necessary.

controls.name: Continuous Incident Response Improvements
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to use qualitative and quantitative data from incident response testing to: 
(1) Determine the effectiveness of incident response processes;
(2) Continuously improve incident response processes; and
(3) Provide incident response measures and metrics that are accurate, consistent and in a reproducible format.

controls.name: Incident Response Training
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to train personnel in their incident response roles and responsibilities.

controls.name: Simulated Incidents
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to incorporate simulated events into incident response training to facilitate effective response by personnel in crisis situations.

controls.name: Automated Incident Response Training Environments
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to provide a more thorough and realistic incident response training environment.

controls.name: Incident Response Testing
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to formally test incident response capabilities through realistic exercises to determine the operational effectiveness of those capabilities.

controls.name: Coordination with Related Plans
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to coordinate incident response testing with organizational elements responsible for related plans.

controls.name: Integrated Security Incident Response Team (ISIRT)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to establish an integrated team of cybersecurity, IT and business function representatives that are capable of addressing cybersecurity and data protection incident response operations.

controls.name: Chain of Custody & Forensics
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform digital forensics and maintain the integrity of the chain of custody, in accordance with applicable laws, regulations and industry-recognized secure practices.

controls.name: Situational Awareness For Incidents
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to document, monitor and report the status of cybersecurity and data protection incidents to internal stakeholders all the way through the resolution of the incident.

controls.name: Automated Tracking, Data Collection & Analysis
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to assist in the tracking, collection and analysis of information from actual and potential cybersecurity and data protection incidents.

controls.name: Recurring Incident Analysis
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to periodically review incident response activities for the existence of recurring incidents.

controls.name: Incident Stakeholder Reporting
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to timely-report incidents to applicable:
(1) Internal stakeholders; 
(2) Affected clients & third-parties; and
(3) Regulatory authorities.

controls.name: Automated Reporting
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to assist in the reporting of cybersecurity and data protection incidents.

controls.name: Cyber Incident Reporting for Sensitive / Regulated Data
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to report sensitive/regulated data incidents in a timely manner.

controls.name: Vulnerabilities Related To Incidents
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to report system vulnerabilities associated with reported cybersecurity and data protection incidents to organization-defined personnel or roles.

controls.name: Supply Chain Coordination
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide cybersecurity and data protection incident information to the provider of the Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) and other organizations involved in the supply chain for TAAS related to the incident.

controls.name: Serious Incident Reporting
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to report any serious incident involving the organization's Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD) to relevant authorities in the locality where the incident occurred, in accordance with mandatory reporting:
(1) Requirements; and
(2) Timelines.

controls.name: Incident Reporting Assistance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide incident response advice and assistance to users of Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) for the handling and reporting of actual and potential cybersecurity and data protection incidents.

controls.name: Automation Support of Availability of Information / Support
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to increase the availability of incident response-related information and support.

controls.name: Coordination With External Providers
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to establish a direct, cooperative relationship between the organization's incident response capability and external service providers.

controls.name: Sensitive / Regulated Data Spill Response
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to respond to sensitive/regulated data spills.

controls.name: Sensitive / Regulated Data Spill Responsible Personnel
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to formally assign personnel or roles with responsibility for responding to sensitive/regulated data spills.

controls.name: Sensitive / Regulated Data Spill Training
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure incident response training material provides coverage for sensitive/regulated data spillage response.

controls.name: Post-Sensitive / Regulated Data Spill Operations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure that organizational personnel impacted by sensitive/regulated data spills can continue to carry out assigned tasks while contaminated Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) are undergoing corrective actions.

controls.name: Sensitive / Regulated Data Exposure to Unauthorized Personnel
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to address security safeguards for personnel exposed to sensitive/regulated data that is not within their assigned access authorizations.

controls.name: Root Cause Analysis (RCA) & Lessons Learned
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to incorporate lessons learned from analyzing and resolving cybersecurity and data protection incidents to reduce the likelihood or impact of future incidents.

controls.name: Regulatory & Law Enforcement Contacts
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to maintain incident response contacts with applicable regulatory and law enforcement agencies.

controls.name: Detonation Chambers (Sandboxes)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize a detonation chamber capability to detect and/or block potentially-malicious files and email attachments.

controls.name: Public Relations & Reputation Repair
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to proactively manage public relations associated with incidents and employ appropriate measures to prevent further reputational damage and develop plans to repair any damage to the organization's reputation.

controls.name: Information Assurance (IA) Operations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of cybersecurity and data protection assessment and authorization controls.

controls.name: Assessment Boundaries
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to establish the scope of assessments by defining the assessment boundary, according to people, processes and technology that directly or indirectly impact the confidentiality, integrity, availability and safety of the Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD) under review.

controls.name: Assessments
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to formally assess the cybersecurity and data protection controls in Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) through Information Assurance Program (IAP) activities to determine the extent to which the controls are implemented correctly, operating as intended and producing the desired outcome with respect to meeting expected requirements.

controls.name: Assessor Independence
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure assessors or assessment teams have the appropriate independence to conduct cybersecurity and data protection control assessments.

controls.name: Specialized Assessments
Third-Party Assessments
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to accept and respond to the results of external assessments that are performed by impartial, external organizations.

controls.name: Security Assessment Report (SAR)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to produce a Security Assessment Report (SAR) at the conclusion of a security assessment to certify the results of the assessment and assist with any remediation actions.

controls.name: System Security & Privacy Plan (SSPP)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to generate System Security & Privacy Plans (SSPPs), or similar document repositories, to identify and maintain key architectural information on each critical Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS), as well as influence inputs, entities and TAAS, providing a historical record of the data and its origins.

controls.name: Plan / Coordinate with Other Organizational Entities
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to plan and coordinate Information Assurance Program (IAP) activities with affected stakeholders before conducting such activities in order to reduce the potential impact on operations.

controls.name: Adequate Security for Sensitive / Regulated Data In Support of Contracts
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect sensitive/regulated data that is collected, developed, received, transmitted, used or stored in support of the performance of a contract.

controls.name: Threat Analysis & Flaw Remediation During Development
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to require system developers and integrators to create and execute a Security Testing and Evaluation (ST&E) plan, or similar process, to identify and remediate flaws during development.

controls.name: Plan of Action & Milestones (POA&M)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to generate a Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M), or similar risk register, to document planned remedial actions to correct weaknesses or deficiencies noted during the assessment of the security controls and to reduce or eliminate known vulnerabilities.

controls.name: Plan of Action & Milestones (POA&M) Automation
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to help ensure the Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M), or similar risk register, is accurate, up-to-date and readily-available.

controls.name: Technical Verification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform Information Assurance Program (IAP) activities to evaluate the design, implementation and effectiveness of technical cybersecurity and data protection controls.

controls.name: Security Authorization
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) are officially authorized prior to "go live" in a production environment.

controls.name: Maintenance Operations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to develop, disseminate, review & update procedures to facilitate the implementation of maintenance controls across the enterprise.

controls.name: Controlled Maintenance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to conduct controlled maintenance activities throughout the lifecycle of the Technology Asset, Application and/or Service (TAAS).

controls.name: Automated Maintenance Activities
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to schedule, conduct and document maintenance and repairs.

controls.name: Timely Maintenance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to obtain maintenance support and/or spare parts for Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) within a defined Recovery Time Objective (RTO).

controls.name: Preventative Maintenance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform preventive maintenance on critical Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Predictive Maintenance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform predictive maintenance on critical Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Automated Support For Predictive Maintenance
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to transfer predictive maintenance data to a computerized maintenance management system.

controls.name: Maintenance Tools
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to control and monitor the use of system maintenance tools.

controls.name: Inspect Tools
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to inspect maintenance tools carried into a facility by maintenance personnel for improper or unauthorized modifications.

controls.name: Inspect Media
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to check media containing diagnostic and test programs for malicious code before the media are used.

controls.name: Prevent Unauthorized Removal
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent or control the removal of equipment undergoing maintenance that contains organizational information.

controls.name: Restrict Tool Usage
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to restrict the use of maintenance tools to authorized maintenance personnel and/or roles.

controls.name: Remote Maintenance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to authorize, monitor and control remote, non-local maintenance and diagnostic activities.

controls.name: Auditing Remote Maintenance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to audit remote, non-local maintenance and diagnostic sessions, as well as review the maintenance action performed during remote maintenance sessions.

controls.name: Remote Maintenance Notifications
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to require maintenance personnel to notify affected stakeholders when remote, non-local maintenance is planned (e.g., date/time).

controls.name: Remote Maintenance Cryptographic Protection
controls.description: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the integrity and confidentiality of remote, non-local maintenance and diagnostic communications.

controls.name: Remote Maintenance Disconnect Verification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide remote disconnect verification to ensure remote, non-local maintenance and diagnostic sessions are properly terminated.

controls.name: Remote Maintenance Pre-Approval
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to require maintenance personnel to obtain pre-approval and scheduling for remote, non-local maintenance sessions.

controls.name: Remote Maintenance Comparable Security & Sanitization
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to require Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) performing remote, non-local maintenance and/or diagnostic services implement a security capability comparable to the capability implemented on the system being serviced.

controls.name: Separation of Maintenance Sessions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect maintenance sessions through replay-resistant sessions that are physically or logically separated communications paths from other network sessions.

controls.name: Authorized Maintenance Personnel
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to maintain a current list of authorized maintenance organizations or personnel.

controls.name: Maintenance Personnel Without Appropriate Access
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure the risks associated with maintenance personnel who do not have appropriate access authorizations, clearances or formal access approvals are appropriately mitigated.

controls.name: Non-System Related Maintenance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure that non-escorted personnel performing non-IT maintenance activities in the physical proximity of systems have required access authorizations.

controls.name: Maintain Configuration Control During Maintenance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to maintain proper physical security and configuration control over technology assets awaiting service or repair.

controls.name: Field Maintenance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to securely conduct field maintenance on geographically deployed assets.

controls.name: Off-Site Maintenance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure off-site maintenance activities are conducted securely and the asset(s) undergoing maintenance actions are secured during physical transfer and storage while off-site.

controls.name: Maintenance Validation
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to validate:
(1) Maintenance activities were appropriately performed according to the work order; and 
(2) Security controls are operational.

controls.name: Maintenance Monitoring
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to maintain situational awareness of the quality and reliability of systems and components through tracking maintenance activities and component failure rates.

controls.name: Centralized Management Of Mobile Devices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement and govern Mobile Device Management (MDM) controls.

controls.name: Access Control For Mobile Devices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce access control requirements for the connection of mobile devices to organizational Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Full Device & Container-Based Encryption
controls.description: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality and integrity of information on mobile devices through full-device or container encryption.

controls.name: Mobile Device Tampering
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect mobile devices from tampering through inspecting devices returning from locations that the organization deems to be of significant risk, prior to the device being connected to the organization's network.

controls.name: Remote Purging
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to remotely purge selected information from mobile devices.

controls.name: Personally-Owned Mobile Devices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict the connection of personally-owned, mobile devices to organizational Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Organization-Owned Mobile Devices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prohibit the installation of non-approved applications or approved applications not obtained through the organization-approved application store.

controls.name: Mobile Device Data Retention Limitations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to limit data retention on mobile devices to the smallest usable dataset and timeframe.

controls.name: Mobile Device Geofencing
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict the functionality of mobile devices based on geographic location.

controls.name: Separate Mobile Device Profiles
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce a separate device workspace on applicable mobile devices to separate work-related and personal-related applications and data.

controls.name: Restricting Access To Authorized Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict the connectivity of unauthorized mobile devices from communicating with organizational Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Network Security Controls (NSC)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to develop, govern & update procedures to facilitate the implementation of Network Security Controls (NSC).

controls.name: Zero Trust Architecture (ZTA)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to treat all users and devices as potential threats and prevent access to data and resources until the users can be properly authenticated and their access authorized.

controls.name: Layered Network Defenses
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement security functions as a layered structure that minimizes interactions between layers of the design and avoids any dependence by lower layers on the functionality or correctness of higher layers.

controls.name: Denial of Service (DoS) Protection
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to protect against or limit the effects of denial of service attacks.

controls.name: Guest Networks
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement and manage a secure guest network.

controls.name: Cross Domain Solution (CDS)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement a Cross Domain Solution (CDS) to mitigate the specific security risks of accessing or transferring information between security domains.

controls.name: Boundary Protection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to monitor and control communications at the external network boundary and at key internal boundaries within the network.

controls.name: Limit Network Connections
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to limit the number of concurrent external network connections to its Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: External Telecommunications Services
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to maintain a managed interface for each external telecommunication service that protects the confidentiality and integrity of the information being transmitted across each interface.

controls.name: Prevent Discovery of Internal Information
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent the public disclosure of internal network information.

controls.name: Personal Data (PD)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to apply network-based processing rules to data elements of Personal Data (PD).

controls.name: Prevent Unauthorized Exfiltration
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to prevent the unauthorized exfiltration of sensitive/regulated data across managed interfaces.

controls.name: Dynamic Isolation & Segregation (Sandboxing)
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to dynamically isolate (e.g., sandbox) untrusted components during runtime, where the component is isolated in a fault-contained environment but it can still collaborate with the application.

controls.name: Isolation of System Components
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to employ boundary protections to isolate Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) that support critical missions and/or business functions.

controls.name: Separate Subnet for Connecting to Different Security Domains
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement separate network addresses (e.g., different subnets) to connect to systems in different security domains.

controls.name: Data Flow Enforcement  Access Control Lists (ACLs)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement and govern Access Control Lists (ACLs) to provide data flow enforcement that explicitly restrict network traffic to only what is authorized.

controls.name: Deny Traffic by Default & Allow Traffic by Exception
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to configure firewall and router configurations to deny network traffic by default and allow network traffic by exception (e.g., deny all, permit by exception).

controls.name: Object Security Attributes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to associate security attributes with information, source and destination objects to enforce defined information flow control configurations as a basis for flow control decisions.

controls.name: Content Check for Encrypted Data
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent encrypted data from bypassing content-checking mechanisms.

controls.name: Embedded Data Types
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce limitations on embedding data within other data types.

controls.name: Metadata
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce information flow controls based on metadata.

controls.name: Human Reviews
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce the use of human reviews for Access Control Lists (ACLs) and similar rulesets on a routine basis.

controls.name: Policy Decision Point (PDP)
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to evaluate access requests against established criteria to dynamically and uniformly enforce access rights and permissions.

controls.name: Data Type Identifiers
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to utilize data type identifiers to validate data essential for information flow decisions when transferring information between different security domains.

controls.name: Decomposition Into Policy-Related Subcomponents
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to decompose information into policy-relevant subcomponents for submission to policy enforcement mechanisms, when transferring information between different security domains.

controls.name: Detection of Unsanctioned Information
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to implement security policy filters requiring fully enumerated formats that restrict data structure and content, when transferring information between different security domains.

controls.name: Approved Solutions
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to examine information for the presence of unsanctioned information and prohibits the transfer of such information, when transferring information between different security domains.

controls.name: Cross Domain Authentication
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to uniquely identify and authenticate source and destination points for information transfer.

controls.name: Metadata Validation
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to apply cybersecurity and/or data protection filters on metadata.

controls.name: Application Proxy
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to terminate, inspect, control and reinitiate application traffic, regardless of the users location or the security posture of the surrounding network.

controls.name: Interconnection Security Agreements (ISAs)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to authorize connections from systems to other systems using Interconnection Security Agreements (ISAs), or similar methods, that document, for each interconnection, the interface characteristics, cybersecurity and data protection requirements and the nature of the information communicated.

controls.name: External System Connections
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prohibit the direct connection of a sensitive system to an external network without the use of an organization-defined boundary protection device.

controls.name: Internal System Connections
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to control internal system connections through authorizing internal connections of systems and documenting, for each internal connection, the interface characteristics, security requirements and the nature of the information communicated.

controls.name: Network Segmentation (macrosegementation)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure network architecture utilizes network segmentation to isolate Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) to protect from other network resources.

controls.name: Security Management Subnets
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement security management subnets to isolate security tools and support components from other internal system components by implementing separate subnetworks with managed interfaces to other components of the system.

controls.name: Virtual Local Area Network (VLAN) Separation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enable Virtual Local Area Networks (VLANs) to limit the ability of devices on a network to directly communicate with other devices on the subnet and limit an attacker's ability to laterally move to compromise neighboring systems.

controls.name: Sensitive / Regulated Data Enclave (Secure Zone)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement segmentation controls to restrict inbound and outbound connectivity for sensitive/regulated data enclaves (secure zones).

controls.name: Segregation From Enterprise Services
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to isolate sensitive/regulated data enclaves (secure zones) from corporate-provided IT resources by providing enclave-specific IT services (e.g., directory services, DNS, NTP, ITAM, antimalware, patch management, etc.) to those isolated network segments.

controls.name: Direct Internet Access Restrictions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prohibit, or strictly-control, Internet access from sensitive/regulated data enclaves (secure zones).

controls.name: Microsegmentation
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to enable microsegmentation, either physically or virtually, to divide the network according to application and data workflows communications needs.

controls.name: Software Defined Networking (SDN)
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to enable dynamic, policy-driven network segmentation, access controls and traffic management with a Software Defined Networking (SDN) architecture.

controls.name: Network Connection Termination
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to terminate network connections at the end of a session or after an organization-defined time period of inactivity.

controls.name: Network Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (NIDS / NIPS)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to employ Network Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (NIDS/NIPS) to detect and/or prevent intrusions into the network.

controls.name: DMZ Networks
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to monitor De-Militarized Zone (DMZ) network segments to separate untrusted networks from trusted networks.

controls.name: Wireless Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (WIDS / WIPS)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to monitor wireless network segments to implement Wireless Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (WIDS/WIPS) technologies.

controls.name: Host Containment
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to enforce host containment protections that revoke or quarantine a hosts access to the network.

controls.name: Resource Containment
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to enforce resource containment protections that remove or quarantine a resources access to other resources.

controls.name: Session Integrity
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect the authenticity and integrity of communications sessions.

controls.name: Invalidate Session Identifiers at Logout
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to invalidate session identifiers upon user logout or other session termination.

controls.name: Unique System-Generated Session Identifiers
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to generate and recognize unique session identifiers for each session.

controls.name: Domain Name Service (DNS) Resolution
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure Domain Name Service (DNS) resolution is designed, implemented and managed to protect the security of name / address resolution.

controls.name: Architecture & Provisioning for Name / Address Resolution Service
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure systems that collectively provide Domain Name Service (DNS) resolution service are fault-tolerant and implement internal/external role separation.

controls.name: Secure Name / Address Resolution Service (Recursive or Caching Resolver)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform data origin authentication and data integrity verification on the Domain Name Service (DNS) resolution responses received from authoritative sources when requested by client systems.

controls.name: Sender Policy Framework (SPF)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to validate the legitimacy of email communications through configuring a Domain Naming Service (DNS) Sender Policy Framework (SPF) record to specify the IP addresses and/or hostnames that are authorized to send email from the specified domain.

controls.name: Domain Registrar Security
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to lock the domain name registrar to prevent a denial of service caused by unauthorized deletion, transfer or other unauthorized modification of a domains registration details.

controls.name: Out-of-Band Channels
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize out-of-band channels for the electronic transmission of information and/or the physical shipment of system components or devices to authorized individuals.

controls.name: Safeguarding Data Over Open Networks
controls.description: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to implement strong cryptography and security protocols to safeguard sensitive/regulated data during transmission over open, public networks.

controls.name: Wireless Link Protection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect external and internal wireless links from signal parameter attacks through monitoring for unauthorized wireless connections, including scanning for unauthorized wireless access points and taking appropriate action, if an unauthorized connection is discovered.

controls.name: End-User Messaging Technologies
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prohibit the transmission of unprotected sensitive/regulated data by end-user messaging technologies.

controls.name: Electronic Messaging
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality, integrity and availability of electronic messaging communications.

controls.name: Remote Access
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define, control and review organization-approved, secure remote access methods.

controls.name: Automated Monitoring & Control
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to monitor and control remote access sessions.

controls.name: Protection of Confidentiality / Integrity Using Encryption
controls.description: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality and integrity of remote access sessions (e.g., VPN).

controls.name: Managed Access Control Points
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to route all remote accesses through managed network access control points (e.g., VPN concentrator).

controls.name: Remote Privileged Commands & Sensitive Data Access
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict the execution of privileged commands and access to security-relevant information via remote access only for compelling operational needs.

controls.name: Work From Anywhere (WFA) - Telecommuting Security
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define secure telecommuting practices and govern remote access to Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD) for remote workers.

controls.name: Third-Party Remote Access Governance
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to proactively control and monitor third-party accounts used to access, support, or maintain system components via remote access.

controls.name: Endpoint Security Validation
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to validate the security posture of the endpoint devices (e.g., software versions, patch levels, etc.) prior to allowing devices to connect to organizational Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Expeditious Disconnect / Disable Capability
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide the capability to expeditiously disconnect or disable a user's remote access session.

controls.name: Wireless Networking
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to control authorized wireless usage and monitor for unauthorized wireless access.

controls.name: Authentication & Encryption
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to secure Wi-Fi (e.g., IEEE 802.11) and prevent unauthorized access by:
(1) Authenticating devices trying to connect; and 
(2) Encrypting transmitted data.

controls.name: Disable Wireless Networking
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to disable unnecessary wireless networking capabilities that are internally embedded within system components prior to issuance to end users.

controls.name: Restrict Configuration By Users
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and explicitly authorize users who are allowed to independently configure wireless networking capabilities.

controls.name: Wireless Boundaries
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to confine wireless communications to organization-controlled boundaries.

controls.name: Rogue Wireless Detection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to test for the presence of Wireless Access Points (WAPs) and identify all authorized and unauthorized WAPs within the facility(ies).

controls.name: Intranets
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to establish trust relationships with other organizations owning, operating, and/or maintaining intranet systems, allowing authorized individuals to: 
(1) Access the intranet from external Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS); and
(2) Process, store, and/or transmit organization-controlled information using the external TAAS.

controls.name: Data Loss Prevention (DLP)
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to implement Data Loss Prevention (DLP) to protect sensitive information as it is stored, transmitted and processed.

controls.name: DNS & Content Filtering
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to force Internet-bound network traffic through a proxy device (e.g., Policy Enforcement Point (PEP)) for URL content filtering and DNS filtering to limit a user's ability to connect to dangerous or prohibited Internet sites.

controls.name: Route Internal Traffic to Proxy Servers
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to route internal communications traffic to external networks through organization-approved proxy servers at managed interfaces.

controls.name: Visibility of Encrypted Communications
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to configure the proxy to make encrypted communications traffic visible to monitoring tools and mechanisms.

controls.name: Route Privileged Network Access
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to route networked, privileged accesses through a dedicated, managed interface for purposes of access control and auditing.

controls.name: Protocol Compliance Enforcement
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to ensure network traffic complies with Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) protocol specifications.

controls.name: Domain Name Verification
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure that domain name lookups, whether for internal or external domains, are validated according to Domain Name System Security Extensions (DNSSEC).

controls.name: Internet Address Denylisting
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement Internet address denylisting protections that blocks traffic received from or destined to a denylisted Internet address.

controls.name: Bandwidth Control
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement bandwidth control technologies to limit the amount of bandwidth used by categories of domains that are bandwidth-intensive.

controls.name: Authenticated Proxy
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to force systems and processes to authenticate Internet-bound traffic with a proxy to enable user, group and/or location-aware security controls.

controls.name: Certificate Denylisting
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent communication with Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) that use a set of known bad certificates.

controls.name: Content Disarm and Reconstruction (CDR)
controls.description: Automated Content Disarm and Reconstruction (CDR) mechanisms exist to detect the presence of unapproved active content and facilitate its removal, resulting in content with only known safe elements.

controls.name: Email Content Protections
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement an email filtering security service to detect malicious attachments in emails and prevent users from accessing them.

controls.name: Email Domain Reputation Protections
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to monitor the organization's email domains reputation and protect the email domains reputation.

controls.name: Sender Denylisting
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement sender denylisting protections that prevent the reception of email from denylisted senders, domains and/or email servers.

controls.name: Authenticated Received Chain (ARC)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize an authenticated received chain that allows for an intermediary to sign its own authentication of the original email, allowing downstream entities to accept the intermediarys authentication even if the email was changed.

controls.name: Domain-Based Message Authentication Reporting and Conformance (DMARC)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement domain signature verification protections that authenticate incoming email according to the Domain-based Message Authentication Reporting and Conformance (DMARC).

controls.name: User Digital Signatures for Outgoing Email
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enable users to digitally sign their emails, allowing external parties to authenticate the emails sender and its contents according to the Domain-based Message Authentication Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) email authentication protocol.

controls.name: Encryption for Outgoing Email
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enable the encryption of outgoing emails using organization-approved cryptographic means.

controls.name: Adaptive Email Protections
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize adaptive email protections that involve employing risk-based analysis in the application and enforcement of email protections.

controls.name: Email Labeling
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to implement email labeling that apply organization-defined tags to incoming or outgoing email.

controls.name: User Threat Reporting
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to incorporate submissions from users of phishing attempts, spam or otherwise malicious actions to better protect the organization.

controls.name: Physical & Environmental Protections
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the operation of physical and environmental protection controls.

controls.name: Physical Security Plan (PSP)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to document a Physical Security Plan (PSP), or similar document, to summarize the implemented security controls to protect physical access to technology assets, as well as applicable risks and threats.

controls.name: Zone-Based Physical Security
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement a zone-based approach to physical security.

controls.name: Physical Access Authorizations
controls.description: Physical access control mechanisms exist to maintain a current list of personnel with authorized access to organizational facilities (except for those areas within the facility officially designated as publicly accessible).

controls.name: Role-Based Physical Access
controls.description: Physical access control mechanisms exist to authorize physical access to facilities based on the position or role of the individual.

controls.name: Dual Authorization for Physical Access
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enforce a "two-person rule" for physical access by requiring two authorized individuals with separate access cards, keys or PINs, to access highly-sensitive areas (e.g., safe, high-security cage, etc.).

controls.name: Physical Access Control
controls.description: Physical access control mechanisms exist to enforce physical access authorizations for all physical access points (including designated entry/exit points) to facilities (excluding those areas within the facility officially designated as publicly accessible).

controls.name: Controlled Ingress & Egress Points
controls.description: Physical access control mechanisms exist to limit and monitor physical access through controlled ingress and egress points.

controls.name: Lockable Physical Casings
controls.description: Physical access control mechanisms exist to protect system components from unauthorized physical access (e.g., lockable physical casings).

controls.name: Physical Access Logs
controls.description: Physical access control mechanisms generate a log entry for each access attempt through controlled ingress and egress points.

controls.name: Access To Critical Systems
controls.description: Physical access control mechanisms exist to enforce physical access to critical systems or sensitive/regulated data, in addition to the physical access controls for the facility.

controls.name: Physical Security of Offices, Rooms & Facilities
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify systems, equipment and respective operating environments that require limited physical access so that appropriate physical access controls are designed and implemented for offices, rooms and facilities.

controls.name: Working in Secure Areas
controls.description: Physical security mechanisms exist to allow only authorized personnel access to secure areas.

controls.name: Searches
controls.description: Physical access control mechanisms exist to inspect personnel and their personal effects (e.g., personal property ordinarily worn or carried by the individual, including vehicles) to prevent the unauthorized exfiltration of data and technology assets.

controls.name: Temporary Storage
