controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify, prioritize and assess suppliers and partners of critical Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) using a supply chain risk assessment process relative to their importance in supporting the delivery of high-value services.

controls.name: Supply Chain Risk Management (SCRM)
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to:
(1) Evaluate security risks and threats associated with Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) supply chains; and
(2) Take appropriate remediation actions to minimize the organization's exposure to those risks and threats, as necessary.

controls.name: Acquisition Strategies, Tools & Methods
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize tailored acquisition strategies, contract tools and procurement methods for the purchase of unique Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Limit Potential Harm
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize security safeguards to limit harm from potential adversaries who identify and target the organization's supply chain.

controls.name: Processes To Address Weaknesses or Deficiencies
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to address identified weaknesses or deficiencies in the security of the supply chain

controls.name: Adequate Supply
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to develop and implement a spare parts strategy to ensure that an adequate supply of critical components is available to meet operational needs.

controls.name: Third-Party Services
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to mitigate the risks associated with third-party access to the organization's Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD).

controls.name: Third-Party Risk Assessments & Approvals
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to conduct a risk assessment prior to the acquisition or outsourcing of technology-related Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: External Connectivity Requirements - Identification of Ports, Protocols & Services
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to require External Service Providers (ESPs) to identify and document the business need for ports, protocols and other services it requires to operate its Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Conflict of Interests
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure that the interests of external service providers are consistent with and reflect organizational interests.

controls.name: Third-Party Processing, Storage and Service Locations
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to restrict the location of information processing/storage based on business requirements.

controls.name: Third-Party Contract Requirements
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to require contractual requirements for cybersecurity and data protection requirements with third-parties, reflecting the organization's needs to protect its Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD).

controls.name: Security Compromise Notification Agreements
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to compel External Service Providers (ESPs) to provide notification of actual or potential compromises in the supply chain that can potentially affect or have adversely affected Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) that the organization utilizes.

controls.name: Contract Flow-Down Requirements
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure cybersecurity and data protection requirements are included in contracts that flow-down to applicable sub-contractors and suppliers.

controls.name: Third-Party Authentication Practices
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure External Service Providers (ESPs) use unique authentication factors for each of its customers.

controls.name: Responsible, Accountable, Supportive, Consulted & Informed (RASCI) Matrix
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to document and maintain a Responsible, Accountable, Supportive, Consulted & Informed (RASCI) matrix, or similar documentation, to delineate assignment for cybersecurity and data protection controls between internal stakeholders and External Service Providers (ESPs).

controls.name: Third-Party Scope Review
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform recurring validation of the Responsible, Accountable, Supportive, Consulted & Informed (RASCI) matrix, or similar documentation, to ensure cybersecurity and data protection control assignments accurately reflect current business practices, compliance obligations, technologies and stakeholders.

controls.name: First-Party Declaration (1PD)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to obtain a First-Party Declaration(1PD) from applicable External Service Providers (ESPs) that provides assurance of compliance with specified statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations for cybersecurity and data protection controls, including any flow-down requirements to subcontractors.

controls.name: Break Clauses
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to include "break clauses" within contracts for failure to meet contract criteria for cybersecurity and/or data protection controls.

controls.name: Third-Party Attestation (3PA)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to obtain an attestation from an independent Third-Party Assessment Organization (3PAO) that provides assurance of conformity with specified statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations for cybersecurity and data protection controls, including any flow-down requirements to contractors and subcontractors.

controls.name: Third-Party Personnel Security
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to control personnel security requirements including security roles and responsibilities for third-party providers.

controls.name: Monitoring for Third-Party Information Disclosure
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to monitor for evidence of unauthorized exfiltration or disclosure of organizational information.

controls.name: Review of Third-Party Services
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to monitor, regularly review and assess External Service Providers (ESPs) for compliance with established contractual requirements for cybersecurity and data protection controls.

controls.name: Third-Party Deficiency Remediation
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to address weaknesses or deficiencies in supply chain elements identified during independent or organizational assessments of such elements.

controls.name: Managing Changes To Third-Party Services
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to control changes to services by suppliers, taking into account the criticality of business Technology Assets, Applications, Services and/or Data (TAASD) that are in scope by the third-party.

controls.name: Third-Party Incident Response & Recovery Capabilities
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure response/recovery planning and testing are conducted with critical suppliers/providers.

controls.name: Threat Intelligence Program
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement a threat intelligence program that includes a cross-organization information-sharing capability that can influence the development of the system and security architectures, selection of security solutions, monitoring, threat hunting, response and recovery activities.

controls.name: Indicators of Exposure (IOE)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to develop Indicators of Exposure (IOE) to understand the potential attack vectors that attackers could use to attack the organization.

controls.name: Threat Intelligence Feeds
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to maintain situational awareness of vulnerabilities and evolving threats by leveraging the knowledge of attacker tactics, techniques and procedures to facilitate the implementation of preventative and compensating controls.

controls.name: Threat Intelligence Reporting
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize external threat intelligence feeds to generate and disseminate organization-specific security alerts, advisories and/or directives.

controls.name: Insider Threat Program
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement an insider threat program that includes a cross-discipline insider threat incident handling team.

controls.name: Insider Threat Awareness
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize security awareness training on recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat.

controls.name: Vulnerability Disclosure Program (VDP)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to establish a Vulnerability Disclosure Program (VDP) to assist with the secure development and maintenance of Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) that receives unsolicited input from the public about vulnerabilities in organizational TAAS.

controls.name: Security Disclosure Contact Information
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to enable public submissions of discovered or potential security vulnerabilities.

controls.name: Threat Hunting
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform cyber threat hunting that uses Indicators of Compromise (IoC) to detect, track and disrupt threats that evade existing security controls.

controls.name: Tainting
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to embed false data or steganographic data in files to enable the organization to determine if data has been exfiltrated and provide a means to identify the individual(s) involved.

controls.name: Threat Catalog
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to develop and keep current a catalog of applicable internal and external threats to the organization, both natural and manmade.

controls.name: Threat Analysis
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify, assess, prioritize and document the potential impact(s) and likelihood(s) of applicable internal and external threats.

controls.name: Behavioral Baselining
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to establish behavioral baselines that capture information about user and entity behavior to enable dynamic threat discovery.

controls.name: Vulnerability & Patch Management Program (VPMP)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation and monitoring of vulnerability management controls.

controls.name: Attack Surface Scope
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define and manage the scope for its attack surface management activities.

controls.name: Vulnerability Remediation Process
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure that vulnerabilities are properly identified, tracked and remediated.

controls.name: Vulnerability Ranking
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and assign a risk ranking to newly discovered security vulnerabilities using reputable outside sources for security vulnerability information.

controls.name: Vulnerability Exploitation Analysis
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify, assess, prioritize and document the potential impact(s) and likelihood(s) of applicable internal and external threats exploiting known vulnerabilities.

controls.name: Continuous Vulnerability Remediation Activities
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to address new threats and vulnerabilities on an ongoing basis and ensure assets are protected against known attacks.

controls.name: Stable Versions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to install the latest stable version of any software and/or security-related updates on all applicable systems.

controls.name: Flaw Remediation with Personal Data (PD)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify and correct flaws related to the collection, usage, processing or dissemination of Personal Data (PD).

controls.name: Deferred Patching Decisions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the deferral of software and/or firmware patches when the disadvantages of applying the patch outweighs the benefits.

controls.name: Software & Firmware Patching
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to conduct software patching for all deployed Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS), including firmware.

controls.name: Centralized Management of Flaw Remediation Processes
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to centrally-manage the flaw remediation process.

controls.name: Automated Remediation Status
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to determine the state of system components with regard to flaw remediation.

controls.name: Time To Remediate / Benchmarks For Corrective Action
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to track the effectiveness of remediation operations through metrics reporting.

controls.name: Automated Software & Firmware Updates
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to install the latest stable versions of security-relevant software and firmware updates.

controls.name: Removal of Previous Versions
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to remove old versions of software and firmware components after updated versions have been installed.

controls.name: Pre-Deployment Patch Testing
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform due diligence on software and/or firmware update stability by conducting pre-production testing in a non-production environment.

controls.name: Out-of-Cycle Patching
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform out-of-cycle software and/or firmware updates to address time-sensitive remediations.

controls.name: Software Patch Integrity
controls.description:
Mechanisms exist to ensure software and/or firmware patches are:
(1) Obtained from trusted sources; and 
(2) Checked for integrity.

controls.name: Vulnerability Scanning
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to detect vulnerabilities and configuration errors by routine vulnerability scanning of systems and applications.

controls.name: Update Tool Capability
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to update vulnerability scanning tools.

controls.name: Breadth / Depth of Coverage
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to identify the breadth and depth of coverage for vulnerability scanning that define the system components scanned and types of vulnerabilities that are checked for.

controls.name: Privileged Access
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement privileged access authorization for selected vulnerability scanning activities.

controls.name: Trend Analysis
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to compare the results of vulnerability scans over time to determine trends in system vulnerabilities.

controls.name: Review Historical event logs
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to review historical event logs to determine if identified vulnerabilities have been previously exploited.

controls.name: External Vulnerability Assessment Scans
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform quarterly external vulnerability scans (outside the organization's network looking inward) via a reputable vulnerability service provider, which include rescans until passing results are obtained or all high vulnerabilities are resolved, as defined by the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS).

controls.name: Internal Vulnerability Assessment Scans
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to perform quarterly internal vulnerability scans, which includes all segments of the organization's internal network, as well as rescans until passing results are obtained or all high vulnerabilities are resolved, as defined by the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS).

controls.name: Acceptable Discoverable Information
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to define what information is allowed to be discoverable by adversaries and take corrective actions to remediate non-compliant Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Correlate Scanning Information
controls.description: Automated mechanisms exist to correlate the output from vulnerability scanning tools to determine the presence of multi-vulnerability/multi-hop attack vectors.

controls.name: Penetration Testing
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to conduct penetration testing on Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS).

controls.name: Independent Penetration Agent or Team
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize an independent assessor or penetration team to perform penetration testing.

controls.name: Technical Surveillance Countermeasures Security
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize a technical surveillance countermeasures survey.

controls.name: Reviewing Vulnerability Scanner Usage
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to monitor logs associated with scanning activities and associated administrator accounts to ensure that those activities are limited to the timeframes of legitimate scans.

controls.name: Red Team Exercises
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize "red team" exercises to simulate attempts by adversaries to compromise Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) in accordance with organization-defined rules of engagement.

controls.name: Web Security
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of an enterprise-wide web management policy, as well as associated standards, controls and procedures.

controls.name: Unauthorized Code
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to prevent unauthorized code from being present in a secure page as it is rendered in a clients browser.

controls.name: Use of Demilitarized Zones (DMZ)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to utilize a Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) to restrict inbound traffic to authorized Technology Assets, Applications and/or Services (TAAS) on certain services, protocols and ports.

controls.name: Web Application Firewall (WAF)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to deploy Web Application Firewalls (WAFs) to provide defense-in-depth protection for application-specific threats.

controls.name: Client-Facing Web Services
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to deploy reasonably-expected security controls to protect the confidentiality and availability of client data that is stored, transmitted or processed by the Internet-based service.

controls.name: Cookie Management
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to provide individuals with clear and precise information about cookies, in accordance with applicable legal requirements for cookie management.

controls.name: Strong Customer Authentication (SCA)
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to implement Strong Customer Authentication (SCA) for consumers to reasonably prove their identity.

controls.name: Web Security Standard
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure the Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) Application Security Verification Standard is incorporated into the organization's Secure Systems Development Lifecycle (SSDLC) process.

controls.name: Web Application Framework
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure a robust Web Application Framework is used to aid in the development of secure web applications, including web services, web resources and web APIs.

controls.name: Validation & Sanitization
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure all input handled by a web application is validated and/or sanitized.

controls.name: Secure Web Traffic
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure all web application content is delivered using cryptographic mechanisms (e.g., TLS).

controls.name: Output Encoding
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure output encoding is performed on all content produced by a web application to reduce the likelihood of cross-site scripting and other injection attacks.

controls.name: Web Browser Security
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to ensure web applications implement Content-Security-Policy, HSTS and X-Frame-Options response headers to protect both the web application and its users.

controls.name: Website Change Detection
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to detect and respond to Indicators of Compromise (IoC) for unauthorized alterations, additions, deletions or changes on websites that store, process and/or transmit sensitive/regulated data.

controls.name: Publicly Accessible Content Reviews
controls.description: Mechanisms exist to routinely review the content on publicly accessible systems for sensitive/regulated data and remove such information, if discovered.
